OK [~accountid:557058:3f7ab89a-8969-4547-90df-53b125e262f7] thank you for the update and the message slack.

I encountered a problem with access to `/users/:id/emails` endpoint.

As GitLab API documentation says I need to have an `admin` role but now I was checking group where I'm `owner`.

I have learned that `users/:id/emails` endpoint available only for self-managed Gitlab instances.
However, we already have users` emails according to project commits. Hence, we may use them for matching.

But we wouldn't know about the user`s email until he pushes a commit.

[~chaka]
We have decided with Andrew to set member's email manually 'cause currently, we have to show up to our main graph.
I have read the neo4j documentation and also I was able to get all users by using the MERGE clause.

I learned how relations work in the cypher language. And I added relationships for:
User->Channel (or Group)
User->Message
Message->Channel
I'm working on adding replies to existing messages.

Submitted by MR - [https://gitlab.com/TaxiNamba/taxi-booking-app-android-new/merge_requests/71]

Added checks for activity state. The crash occurred due to the fact that the activity on which the fragment was attached was no longer busy. But which thread called showSimpleAlert. And during the detachment of the fragment from the activity, the showSimpleAlert method was called in which there were no checks for the state of the activity, because of this, a crash occurs.
MR accepted [https://gitlab.com/TaxiNamba/taxi-booking-app-android-new/merge_requests/71]

Fixed by adding a check for null, the logic of calling the method was not built correctly.

Communication with Artur, wrote to the doc, it was decided to set up backups with coltaxi according to the old scheme, and then create a separate task to remake the mechanism for collecting backups on the taxi backup server.
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Sme3GuQe9DGB3aI7bRy1MUVRVNKQAeBw0OEqhj8EpBg/edit

Backup server script with corrected checksum calculation and folder structure, added removal of old calls.

{code:java}
#!/bin/bash

BACKUP_FOLDER=/mnt/backup
DAYS_TO_STORE=30
DATE_NOW=$(date +%F)

PRJ_NAMES=( "operator.oshfood.kg" "oshfood.kg" "nambafood.kg" "nambafood.swift.kg" "islegtm.com" "operator.islegtm.com" )
BACKUP_EXIST_CURLS=( "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/0617c004-6b2a-43a2-b99c-f3e4ffc0290b" "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/0ca5940d-9b77-4430-9433 -5bbceddc2f0c" "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/962f5eb9-585f-4122-9bd4-c474b0897f5f" "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/dd8c41f0-08e0-42fa-8cf9 -66d85e1fbbee" "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/bd4a61d4-e6f2-4c8e-aada-b8c2835b569e" "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/ee545e04-12f3-45b6-9827 -3dd8829aee71" )
BACKUP_SOLID=( "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/a27bd187-e7bd-4bad-bc34-fd64d62228af" "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/08e5fc77-5876-4b15-a3db -fa034b1ff74f" "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/6dba142c-03b4-49f3-84bb-201927b6d4af" "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/954bf081-e5ab-49fe-84c0 -cf0f658a8c76" "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/a734ca64-1ca3-440b-8b34-8871bba69669" "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/16b61b89-e0da-4002-803b -4b50fe108745" )
declare -A RSYNC_DONE


remove_old_backups() {
for PROJECT_DIR in `ls $BACKUP_FOLDER`
do
for TIMESTAMP_BACKUP in `ls $BACKUP_FOLDER/$PROJECT_DIR`
do
if date -d $TIMESTAMP_BACKUP +%s > /dev/null 2>&1; then
if [ "`date -d $TIMESTAMP_BACKUP +%s`" -lt "`date -d \"$DAYS_TO_STORE days ago\" +%s`" ]; then
rm -rf $BACKUP_FOLDER/$PROJECT_DIR/$TIMESTAMP_BACKUP
fi
fi
done
done
}


remove_old_calls() {
for PROJECT_DIR in `ls $BACKUP_FOLDER`
do
 if [ -d "$BACKUP_FOLDER/$PROJECT_DIR/freeswitch_calls_archive" ]; then
for TIMESTAMP in `ls "$BACKUP_FOLDER/$PROJECT_DIR/freeswitch_calls_archive/taxi-freeswitch/in/"`
do
if [ "`date -d $TIMESTAMP +%s`" -lt "`date -d \"$DAYS_TO_STORE days ago\" +%s`" ]; then
                                rm -rf $BACKUP_FOLDER/$PROJECT_DIR/freeswitch_calls_archive/taxi-freeswitch/*/$TIMESTAMP
         fi
done

fi
done
}

mkdir_all() {
for NAME in ${PRJ_NAMES[@]}
do
mkdir -p $BACKUP_FOLDER/$NAME/$DATE_NOW
done
}

backup_all() {
#operator.oshfood.kg and oshfood.kg

sudo rsync --bwlimit=5000 -a -e "ssh -p 31862 -i /home/backup-server/.ssh/id_rsa" backup-server@operator.oshfood.kg:/mnt/backup/* $BACKUP_FOLDER/operator .oshfood.kg/ >> /tmp/operator_oshfood_remover.log 2>&1
RSYNC_DONE
sudo rsync --bwlimit=5000 -a -e "ssh -p 31862 -i /home/backup-server/.ssh/id_rsa" backup@oshfood.kg:/mnt/backup/* $BACKUP_FOLDER/oshfood.kg/ > > /tmp/oshfood_remover.log 2>&1


#nambafood and nambafood.swift.kg

sudo rsync --bwlimit=5000 -a -e "ssh -p 47305 -i /home/backup-server/.ssh/id_rsa" backup-server@nambafood.kg:/mnt/backup/* $BACKUP_FOLDER/nambafood.kg / >> /tmp/nambafood_remover.log 2>&1
sudo rsync --bwlimit=5000 -a -e "ssh -i /home/backup-server/.ssh/id_rsa" backup-server@nambafood.swift.kg:/mnt/backup/* $BACKUP_FOLDER/nambafood.swift. kg/ >> /tmp/nambafood_swift_remover.log 2>&1

# islegtm.com and operator.islegtm.com


sudo rsync --bwlimit=5000 -a -e "ssh -p 47305 -i /home/backup-server/.ssh/id_rsa" backup-server@operator.islegtm.com:/mnt/backup/* $BACKUP_FOLDER/operator .islegtm.com/ >> /tmp/operator_islegtm_remover.log 2>&1
sudo rsync --bwlimit=5000 -a -e "ssh -p 47305 -i /home/backup-server/.ssh/id_rsa" backup-server@islegtm.com:/mnt/backup/* $BACKUP_FOLDER/islegtm.com / >> /tmp/islegtm_remover.log 2>&1

}

check_backup_success() {

for i in ${!PRJ_NAMES[@]}
do
if find /$BACKUP_FOLDER/"${PRJ_NAMES[$i]}"/ -mindepth 1 | read > /dev/null; then
    curl -fsS --retry 3 "${BACKUP_EXIST_CURLS[$i]}" > /dev/null
fi
done
}

backup_sha_compare() {
for PRJ_INDEX in ${!PRJ_NAMES[@]}
        do
SHA_HERE=""
        PATHS=$( find $BACKUP_FOLDER/"${PRJ_NAMES[$PRJ_INDEX]}"/* -name "*" ! -name "sha.txt" -type f | sort )
        for FILE in $PATHS
           do
                        TEMP=$( sha1sum "$FILE" | awk '{ print $1 }' )
                       # echo "$FILE $TEMP"
                        SHA_HERE="$SHA_HERE $TEMP"
                done

        SHA_HERE=$( echo "$SHA_HERE" | sha1sum | awk '{ print $1 }' )
        SHA_FROM=$( cat $BACKUP_FOLDER/"${PRJ_NAMES[$PRJ_INDEX]}"/sha.txt )

if [ "$SHA_HERE" == "$SHA_FROM" ]; then
curl -fsS --retry 3 "${BACKUP_SOLID[$PRJ_INDEX]}" > /dev/null
else
echo "$DATE_NOW: Corrupt Folder" >> $BACKUP_FOLDER/"${PRJ_NAME[$PRJ_INDEX]}"/error_log.txt
fi
                done
}

remove_old_backups
remove_old_calls
mkdir_all
backup_all
check_backup_success
backup_sha_compare

{code}

{code:java}
#!/bin/bash

BACKUP_FOLDER=/mnt/backup
DAYS_TO_STORE=30
DATE_NOW=$(date +%F)

PRJ_NAMES=( "operator.oshfood.kg" "oshfood.kg" "nambafood.kg" "nambafood.swift.kg" "islegtm.com" "operator.islegtm.com" )
BACKUP_EXIST_CURLS=( "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/0617c004-6b2a-43a2-b99c-f3e4ffc0290b" "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/0ca5940d-9b77-4430-9433 -5bbceddc2f0c" "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/962f5eb9-585f-4122-9bd4-c474b0897f5f" "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/dd8c41f0-08e0-42fa-8cf9 -66d85e1fbbee" "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/bd4a61d4-e6f2-4c8e-aada-b8c2835b569e" "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/ee545e04-12f3-45b6-9827 -3dd8829aee71" )
BACKUP_SOLID=( "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/a27bd187-e7bd-4bad-bc34-fd64d62228af" "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/08e5fc77-5876-4b15-a3db -fa034b1ff74f" "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/6dba142c-03b4-49f3-84bb-201927b6d4af" "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/954bf081-e5ab-49fe-84c0 -cf0f658a8c76" "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/a734ca64-1ca3-440b-8b34-8871bba69669" "https://cron.monitoring.maddevs.co/ping/16b61b89-e0da-4002-803b -4b50fe108745" )

remove_old_backups() {
for PROJECT_DIR in `ls $BACKUP_FOLDER`
do
for TIMESTAMP_BACKUP in `ls $BACKUP_FOLDER/$PROJECT_DIR`
do
if date -d $TIMESTAMP_BACKUP +%s > /dev/null 2>&1; then
if [ "`date -d $TIMESTAMP_BACKUP +%s`" -lt "`date -d \"$DAYS_TO_STORE days ago\" +%s`" ]; then
rm -rf $BACKUP_FOLDER/$PROJECT_DIR/$TIMESTAMP_BACKUP
fi
fi
done
done
}


remove_old_calls() {
for PROJECT_DIR in `ls $BACKUP_FOLDER`
do
 if [ -d "$BACKUP_FOLDER/$PROJECT_DIR/freeswitch_calls_archive/in" ]; then
for TIMESTAMP in `ls "$BACKUP_FOLDER/$PROJECT_DIR/freeswitch_calls_archive/taxi-freeswitch/in/"`
do
if [ "`date -d $TIMESTAMP +%s`" -lt "`date -d \"$DAYS_TO_STORE days ago\" +%s`" ]; then
                                rm -rf $BACKUP_FOLDER/$PROJECT_DIR/freeswitch_calls_archive/taxi-freeswitch/*/$TIMESTAMP
         fi
done

fi
        if [ -d "$BACKUP_FOLDER/$PROJECT_DIR/freeswitch_calls_archive/out" ]; then
        for TIMESTAMP in `ls "$BACKUP_FOLDER/$PROJECT_DIR/freeswitch_calls_archive/taxi-freeswitch/out/"`
        do
         if [ "`date -d $TIMESTAMP +%s`" -lt "`date -d \"$DAYS_TO_STORE days ago\" +%s`" ]; then
                                rm -rf $BACKUP_FOLDER/$PROJECT_DIR/freeswitch_calls_archive/taxi-freeswitch/*/$TIMESTAMP
         fi
        done

fi

done
}

mkdir_all() {
for NAME in ${PRJ_NAMES[@]}
do
mkdir -p $BACKUP_FOLDER/$NAME
done
}

backup_all() {
#operator.oshfood.kg and oshfood.kg

sudo rsync --bwlimit=5000 -a -e "ssh -p 31862 -i /home/backup-server/.ssh/id_rsa" backup-server@operator.oshfood.kg:/mnt/backup/* $BACKUP_FOLDER/operator .oshfood.kg/ >> /tmp/operator_oshfood_remover.log 2>&1 && curl -fsS --retry 3 "${BACKUP_EXIST_CURLS[0]}"
sudo rsync --bwlimit=5000 -a -e "ssh -p 31862 -i /home/backup-server/.ssh/id_rsa" backup@oshfood.kg:/mnt/backup/* $BACKUP_FOLDER/oshfood.kg/ > > /tmp/oshfood_remover.log 2>&1 && curl -fsS --retry 3 "${BACKUP_EXIST_CURLS[1]}"


#nambafood and nambafood.swift.kg

sudo rsync --bwlimit=5000 -a -e "ssh -p 47305 -i /home/backup-server/.ssh/id_rsa" backup-server@nambafood.kg:/mnt/backup/* $BACKUP_FOLDER/nambafood.kg / >> /tmp/nambafood_remover.log 2>&1 && curl -fsS --retry 3 "${BACKUP_EXIST_CURLS[2]}"
sudo rsync --bwlimit=5000 -a -e "ssh -i /home/backup-server/.ssh/id_rsa" backup-server@nambafood.swift.kg:/mnt/backup/* $BACKUP_FOLDER/nambafood.swift. kg/ >> /tmp/nambafood_swift_remover.log 2>&1 && curl -fsS --retry 3 "${BACKUP_EXIST_CURLS[3]}"

# islegtm.com and operator.islegtm.com


sudo rsync --bwlimit=5000 -a -e "ssh -p 47305 -i /home/backup-server/.ssh/id_rsa" backup-server@operator.islegtm.com:/mnt/backup/* $BACKUP_FOLDER/operator .islegtm.com/ >> /tmp/operator_islegtm_remover.log 2>&1 && curl -fsS --retry 3 "${BACKUP_EXIST_CURLS[4]}"
sudo rsync --bwlimit=5000 -a -e "ssh -p 47305 -i /home/backup-server/.ssh/id_rsa" backup-server@islegtm.com:/mnt/backup/* $BACKUP_FOLDER/islegtm.com / >> /tmp/islegtm_remover.log 2>&1 && curl -fsS --retry 3 "${BACKUP_EXIST_CURLS[5]}"

}

backup_sha_compare() {
for PRJ_INDEX in ${!PRJ_NAMES[@]}
        do
SHA_HERE=""
        PATHS=$( find $BACKUP_FOLDER/"${PRJ_NAMES[$PRJ_INDEX]}"/* -name "*" ! -name "sha.txt" -type f | sort )
        for FILE in $PATHS
           do
                        TEMP=$( sha1sum "$FILE" | awk '{ print $1 }' )
                       # echo "$FILE $TEMP"
                        SHA_HERE="$SHA_HERE $TEMP"
                done

        SHA_HERE=$( echo "$SHA_HERE" | sha1sum | awk '{ print $1 }' )
        SHA_FROM=$( cat $BACKUP_FOLDER/"${PRJ_NAMES[$PRJ_INDEX]}"/sha.txt )

if [ "$SHA_HERE" == "$SHA_FROM" ]; then
curl -fsS --retry 3 "${BACKUP_SOLID[$PRJ_INDEX]}" > /dev/null
else
echo "$DATE_NOW: Corrupt Folder" >> $BACKUP_FOLDER/"${PRJ_NAME[$PRJ_INDEX]}"/error_log.txt
fi
                done
}

remove_old_backups
remove_old_calls
mkdir_all
backup_all
backup_sha_compare

Import guideline:
 # We need to get DDL for table that we want to import. For Mongo it is best to use varchar(max) as a type for all columns, for SQL databases you can simply use create queries that database server can generate.

{code:java}
CREATE TABLE jackfruit_user_get_course_logs (
_id varchar(max),
course_id varchar(max),
created_at varchar(max),
updated_at varchar(max),
user_id varchar(max)
);
{code}

 # With that DDL you need to create table on Redshift
 # You need to export data from database to local csv file

{code:java}
mongoexport --uri="mongodb://jackfruittl:jackfruittl.edumall%40topica@sgdbsector20.edumall.vn:27017/jackfruittl" --type=csv --collection=user_get_course_logs --out=etl_jackfruit_user_get_course_logs.csv --fields "_id ,course_id,created_at,updated_at,user_id"
{code}

 # Upload file on s3

{code:java}
aws s3 cp etl_jackfruit_user_get_course_logs.csv s3://dw-data-lake-integration/etl_jackfruit_user_get_course_logs/etl_jackfruit_user_get_course_logs.csv{code}

 # On Redshift run copy command from s3

{code:java}
copy etl.jackfruit_user_get_course_logs
from 's3://dw-data-lake-integration/etl_jackfruit_user_get_course_logs/'
ACCESS_KEY_ID 'AKIAVDEOU636FKDVEPF3'

maxerror 10

Normally, Lead type "c3_credit" has 4 main e-payment status. (Ideally, it should be like to logic below)
 * Incomplete: First status since the customer submit the form (Sales will not be able to get (to Telesales system) Lead type = c3_credit & e-payment status = incomplete)
 * Complete: When customer successfully paid via online payment (Sales will not be able to get (to Telesales system) Lead type = c3_credit & e-payment status = complete)
 * Failed: When customer fail to pay via online payment (Sales will be able to get (to Telesales system) Lead type = c3_credit & e-payment status = Failed)
 * Timeout: When customer does not finish the payment within 10 minutes, the status will be changed from "incomplete" to "timeout" by the system(Sales will be able to get (to Telesales system) Lead type = c3_credit & e-payment status=timeout)

However, some of the leads (c3_credit with incomplete status) do not changed from "incomplete" to "timeout" after 10 minutes.

Problem: Sales team cannot make a call to the leads that the status are not changed.



Here is the list of leads that has an error: [Incomplete Leads Performance|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/14mtyUnrkp_Jxm-Kr8KqoC_h7yxStqYjd2FoHfszy_GA/edit?pli=1#gid=381675780]

However, I've found that there are some c3_cod leads that have "incomplete" status.



My question is what is the meaning of c3_cod with complete status?

Explored the code, looked for all pieces of code that could change e-payment status of c3_cod leads. Looked at Minerva and Marol. And found that such operations could be done in Marol, all other places doesn't seem to be related to it. Especially found update_payment_status method in app/controllers/contact_api_controller line 73. Third party services can change the type of the contactc3 by sending request to that action method passing the id and status of the contactc3 in parameters. If we send "complete" status for a contactc3 there will be a check for if there are other contactc3s with the same email, course_id, in case there are then all that contactc3s will have their statuses changed to "completed" and some of them may have type equal to c3_cod. That's what i managed to find

[~azat17]

[~saran] Yes, it's the same we are using now. Also i'm not fully sure if other landings may or may not send this request to change the status.

But what i've found now is that this ticket's behavior may appear when some contactc3's status is changed and at the same time there are other contactc3s which have the same course_id and email as that contactc3 which had its status changed and in that case their ( duplicated contacts)) statuses will also change.
[~azat17] Any suggested solution to prevent this, I think it is not correct to have c3_cod with complete status in our database.

[~saran] we can add a clause in that request by which not to take duplicated contactc3 which have c3_cod type . Such way i can prevent status updating of c3_cod leads in that request and further see if we get any c3_cod with complete status or not.

* FPC has been fixed.
 * Added css minification and merging.
 * Reduced number of HTTP requests by JS bundling & merging. An advanced approach has been used. Bundle size is ~4.5 times smaller than with standard settings.
 * Some bugs fixed: css merging, inappropriate widgets initialization, jwplayer and others

Thailand and Vietnam now have the same optimizations, but TH score is still lower then VN (~30 vs ~55). Let's see what the difference is and what needs to be done.

!85_2_th.png|thumbnail!!85_2_vn.png|thumbnail!
 # Remove yandex metrica or disable unused features. It occupies CPU for 3sec.
 # Figure out what is https://edumallth.api.useinsider.com/ins.js?id=10003632. It occupies CPU for 1sec.
 # Figure out why TTFB on TH is 2 times higher than on VN (400-600ms vs 180-300ms). I remember we had a similar problem on VN in the past [~khalezin.d]

||site||3rd party script||CPU Time||Script Evaluation||
|VN|[https://mc.yandex.ru/metrika/tag.js]|71 ms|57 ms|
|TH|[https://mc.yandex.ru/metrika/tag.js]|2,884 ms|2,312 ms|
|VN|https://edumall.api.useinsider.com/ins.js?id=10002141|398 ms|265 ms|
|TH|https://edumallth.api.useinsider.com/ins.js?id=10003632|1,009 ms|748 ms|

Summary: ins.js and ynadex metrica takes 4 seconds, which is 200% of time needed to process all javascript in magento.

Hi [~luandv]

Here are my recommendations:
 # get rid of all suffixes please: .html


 # From the SEO point of view, parent category and child category are the same in a matter of importance!
parent Category link: [http://staging.edumall.co.th/marketing123|http://staging.edumall.co.th/marketing123.html.]
child Category link: [http://staging.edumall.co.th/content-marketing]
But breadcrumbs and internal structure should consider parent and child categories. Let's leave settings in this way. Why:

The deeper URLs structure you have, then “weaker” these pages for Google’s ranking. In your case category should = subcategory, because for Google and for user these pages are in the same priority, no matter is the self development (category) or career development (subcategory).

 # *The most important issue you should consider before deploy to avoid a bunch of errors:*
Old URLs should have *301 redirects to new URLs*, considering structure and .html. Usually developers do in .htaccess file. *It's a highly important!*


And I don't know why, but I create all tasks in Audit Backlog with detailed description like a technical task, but here you create tickets without detailed description. Here you can find more detailed description for this task:

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/19TAmH5w7tcN27l8-m-aSaDCZz9Ps4SZtyYvgjfDdZiA/edit#|https://docs.google.com/document/d/19TAmH5w7tcN27l8-m-aSaDCZz9Ps4SZtyYvgjfDdZiA/edit]

Everything is good except one thing: *product URLs it's a big problem and URL duplication.*

]

Category:

From HomePage:[
http://staging.edumall.co.th/businessmodeldesigner-designabusinessmodelthat-ssexy] (I haven't found Facebook Ads course but you can see it here)

*The Solution:*
 # If product in your marketplace can be assigned just for one category (not several), use in url slug parent category name
 # If product in your marketplace can be assigned for several categories, use in url slug static edumall.co.th/course/courseNAME
 # Show in breadcrumbs full path (homepage -> category -> parent category -> course name) *!!!*
 # **Consider, that Schema.ORG should be updated after updating breadcrumbs settings.

Integration of stipe in the project:

In order for our system to work with stripe, you need to complete the tasks MIC-879 MIC-880

That is, add logic on the frontend and backend

Estimated backend without any unforeseen problems *30 hours*

The frontend must be evaluated by the frontender
Connecting a stripe to a project:

1. Create an account
2. Link a card to withdraw money from the system
3. Customize the invoice payment page (Logo, page styles, etc.)
4. Get api tokens for the API service and specify them in our admin panel

In principle, these are all the steps that need to be taken in order to connect the stripe to the system (you only need to write code in our system for integration once)

Note: According to all the information that I found, registering and connecting a card for a new stripe account is a fast procedure and can be done and connected to the backend in 1 hour and you can immediately use this payment method

*BUT* although we are not going to use any advanced features of the stripe, but simply use it as a "System for accepting payments", *account after registration can (unlikely, but possible) be checked for about 1 week*

Payment flow:

Similar to all other payment methods

1. The user logs in to our website (for example, citycam.kg)
2. Selects the tariff that he wants to purchase
3. Selects the stripe payment method
3.1 An invoice is created on the backend in the stripe system and ours + user in the stripe system if not already created
4. The button "Proceed to payment" is displayed to him or he is automatically redirected to the payment page

After the 4th step, the user gets to the payment page of the stripe system, that is, this is neither our backend or frontend
Note: This page can be customized in stripe system admin panel

5. The user got to the payment page
6. The user selects the payment method for the invoice in the stripe system
7. The user pays the invoice

After successful payment, the user is returned to our system

8. Stripe sends an event to our backend that the invoice was paid and our system issues a subscription to the user
9. The user returns to our site (for example: citycam.kg) and can use his premium access

edited /opt/docker/nginx/docker-compose.yml configuration on the production server



For the jwilder/nginx-proxy image, the SSL_POLICY virtual environment variable accepts one of the ready-made TLS version pesets

IMPORTANT: So that the TLS versions would include TLSv1 as only terminals support it

{code:yml}
environment:
      - SSL_POLICY=Mozilla-Old
{code}

Yes that's right.

As a working version for research:
 # Use our current open street map
 # We pull traffic data from Google once in a while and cache (for example, once every half an hour)
 # The frontend goes to the backend cache and fetches data to render the traffic layer

Risks:
 # The current map lags at 50 marks with cameras on weak phones

You can go by using Yandex Maps or Google Maps on the front and also cache the data so as not to use a large number of requests.

According to my calculation, 1000 requests per day from Yandex will be enough to show the situation on the roads quite often.

If you update the data once every 5 minutes, it will send 288 requests per day.

LGTM
Customer will provide a postcode, need to return categories and provided services within his postcode.

The end points are:

## Get Categories by a postcode of the Customer

**GET** `/api/v1/customer_postcode_services`

Param structure
```
postcode: 'e1 7ad'
```

## ## Get Services under Category by postcode of a Customer

**GET** `/api/v1/customer_postcode_services/:category_id`

Param structure
```
postcode: 'e1 7ad'
```

164
When signing up as a provider, I uploaded the four required documents. I attempted a DOC file, a PDF file, a PNG file and a JPG file. I was immediately shown a “Failed” message (see attached image).
I tried hitting “Save & Continue” again and was shown the “Failed” message. As a user, I am now stuck at this screen as I will feel that I am unable to upload my documents and would likely quit (I was able to continue by deleting the JPG file and uploading the same file I had for one of the other documents). Interestingly, I was able to upload a JPG with no difficulty when adding a qualification later on in the process.
Checking in the back end, all but the JPG file had successfully uploaded and were visible to me as an admin. For the JPG file, I was shown the error screen (see attached image).
As I have reported on this issue before, my computer chooses “Custom Files” when looking for files to upload at this point. Are we able to tell the users computers what files to display here or is it not possible? I just ask as I am able to see JPG, PNG and PDF files but not DOC files. I have to select "All files" in the search window.
165
As with the issue above, when uploading images for the portfolio, I received a “Failed” message (see attached image). The tick was against the PNG image, which is also the smallest in file size. All other files were JPG and between 4mb and 5mb. Is this part of the issue? If we are re-sizing/downscaling the images to a certain extent, this shouldn't be an issue? Besides, most photos from smartphones are of similar size, plus a user would expect a decent quality image to be displayed when they are showing their best work to a potential customer.
When checking the Admin panel, the pictures that did not appear to upload were not visible in the back end, unlike in issue 164. As a user, I was only able to proceed by deleting all JPG files I attempted and use PNG files.
166
The User Terms agreement has not been uploaded with the correct formatting (please see the attached examples which are reflective of the whole document). The titles of each point aren't spaced out correctly, some spaces are missing and it overall makes a confusing document even more confusing to read.
167 - one screen instead of two, change text, main points
When a provider accepts the Terms and Conditions, they very briefly see the screen telling them that “We Are Currently Reviewing Your Application” but it immediately changes to “Everything’s great!!!” (see process attached from Figma). This doesn't make sense as the provider will likely believe their application has been checked instantaneously.
It might be easier to resolve this here if we combine the two screens into one? So, we would have the title “We Are Currently Reviewing Your Application” with the message underneath reading “Thank you for submitting your application to Sorted House. We will be in touch once your application has been checked by one of the team.” Then the image of the reading glasses underneath that. The blue “Continue” button can still be present (otherwise the user is trapped on this screen) so they can see their account and then we will send the provider an email to let them know their account has been verified and they can expect to see jobs coming their way.
168
The provider received the following notification (also attached): “The provider's account has been confirmed.” I have changed this notification to: “Good news! Your account is now live.” I was confused as this notification is listed as an Admin notification, but it is displayed to the user in their account?
169
All through the provider application process, the provider has had no emails sent to them. Is this something we need to handle via Websand (@Saul G?) or can we add these ourselves in the back end (or does it require code so the notification knows when to be sent)? There are an email notifications in the back end (number 36 and 38) that should be sent during registration.
Also, the Admin didn't receive any emails to let them know that a new provider had registered. As above, there is a notification set up for this in the back end (number 40) but it wasn't sent out.

170 error on postcode
When registering a test provider, I got to the “Where are you willing to work?” screen and was unable to choose “Save & Continue” as it was greyed out. This hadn't happened on previous tests and no matter what information I changed, it remained greyed out. As there is no “Go Back” button on this screen (which I'm sure we discussed previously that we need to give the option to go back during this process in case things are missed? I know you mentioned some screens this might not be possible?).
Hitting back on the browser didn't work. I refreshed the page and this time it changed the button to blue when I entered the same postcode I had already tried previously.

171 add padding

customer sign up process.

 job status
 # Creation of record - customer only.
 # Job completed - post to relevant Provider record.
 # Paid.
 # Rating.

Install aws-cli

export credit


{code:java}
export AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID="aaaaa"
export AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY="aaaaaaaaa"
export AWS_DEFAULT_REGION="eu-central-1"
{code}


Upload files


{code:java}
aws s3 cp ~/Documents/download.png s3://sorted-house-staging-bucket/
upload: Documents/download.png to s3://sorted-house-staging-bucket/download.png

{code}




Ls files


{code:java}
aws s3 ls s3://sorted-house-staging-bucket/
2020-06-08 11:19:48 2164 download.png

{code}

{panel:title=Maxim's comment}
We have an endpoint. *GET* {{/api/v1/jobs}}

You need to add parameters to it for the endpoint to sort by field
 # job state
 # title
 #provider-full-name
 # deadline
 # created-date

and also the sort option

For example /api/v1/jobs?field=title&sort=desc

Sorts by the title field in reverse order, if we need alphabetical order, then the sort=desc parameter is not specified

[~iain] Please clarify the following feedback:
 # - Text when confirming email address - Needs changed. *What changes?*
 # - The Terms and Conditions displayed are for a provider, not a customer. *Would you please send me Terms & Conditions for Customer then?*
 # - Following on from above, it has pulled the address through with only a number and the postcode. Google Maps had a popup saying it wasn't configured correctly, but the location is correct on the map. If I choose to edit the address, the same form from Sign Up is present. It is asking me to manually add an entire address into one box - not User Friendly (e.g. as both fields are mandatory, it's possible to add postcode twice as it feels natural to add you entire address into the bottom box since that what it asks) . - I know we need to talk about Google Maps from a post you put on the board the other day - [@Saul G|https://sortedhouse-maddevs.slack.com/team/UM3UT9GCF] was wanting to talk about this I think? I don't know if we need the level of integration (e.g. being able to move the map around, zoom etc.), we were just wanting a picture of the map that the User (provider) could click on and it would take them externally to Google Maps (which they could then use for directions if they were using their phone, for example). *Google Maps are not expensive at all, do you want to talk about it cause of the cost or some other reason?*
 # - Notifications are turned on as default but we didn't ask this during the sign up process. I think this was discussed at some point for providers but not sure if this is allowed for customers by GDPR (mainly the Marketing emails option). For SMS, it can be argued that these are service messages so must be kept on, but I think we had addressed this for providers. Currently a customer could turn these off which would mean it would be hard for us to get in touch with them? *I didn't understand your point, what do you want after all? Do we need to bring back these notifications into Sign Up?*
 # - Customer can add a profile picture/avatar but the popup box addresses the User as if they are a provider (text has been shared from provider account). However, we aren't sure if we need to give customers the ability to add a photo. These wouldn't be monitored by Sorted House or require approval, so we think this option should be disabled. *When provider gets a job or something we want to show the Customer's avatar or photo, do you really want to remove functionality which already works?*
 # - When supplying references, same issue with input of Contact Number- **We need to supply GDPR text for this** *Would you please provide the text and exact place you want to put it in?*

one. **

Please change "_The input is not valid E-mail!_" to "Please enter a valid email address"

Please change "_The input is not valid E-mail! Two emails that you enter is inconsistent!_" to "The email address entered does not match"



2.

Hopefully I have attached the Terms and Conditions for users correctly below. Just let me know if I haven't and I can send them on Slack or by email:

[^Sorted House User Terms 24.01.17.doc]





3.

four.

As with 3, I will discuss with Saul the best route on this, as I am worried that we won't be able to turn on email notifications without consent first. I could be wrong on this however, so will confirm how we want to go ahead.



5.

Potentially we want to remove this as we are unsure if customers would want any picture of themselves being available to tradespeople. As it would not be monitored, it would be open to abuse (explicit/illegal images etc.). The only way round this would be to give the customer a selection of default avatars to choose from to prevent it from looking blank when the provider viewed the job? I think we will want to remove this but, with 3 and 4, please let me discuss and confirm first.



6.

I will collaborate with Saul on this one and provide text.

# Apologies if there has been confusion caused on this with my explanation. If you would rather we discuss it on Friday so we are clear, we will be happy to do so. I will try and explain more what I mean here though to give you a better idea. I have attached an example which is extremely common for address entry on a website. You can see that Postcode is asked for first, and they have the option to find address, which then normally just requires a user to enter their door number/building name. I know we don't have that functionality (as I presume it is a paid extra) and I am also aware that full postcode is our primary piece of information. However, the current format used in the design is confusing in its layout. Can we add the individual cells for each part of the address (as shown in the attachment) and make them all mandatory, keeping postcode entry first? It is clear to the User that they need to give us the full address and prevents a confusing UX (it wasn't clear to me how to write the full address into the cell in the current design)._!Sorted House - Address Example .JPG|width=402,height=389! _
 # I tried to upload a variety of files, all of which had extensions that were permissible, and after clicking submit it attempted to upload them and failed. This happened each time I tried with the same files. I was only able to upload one type of extension (.jpg) successfully to get past this stage of the process.



 # I see. I should be able to click the link and be taken straight through. Are you able to confirm what my password is, in case it is auto-filled incorrectly, causing an issue?



_I have a couple of answers to previous questions having spoke with Andy:_

*Google Maps*: For our providers, particularly those using the service on their mobiles, the normal practice we want is that a provider can click on the location in the from of a map image which will them open in their maps app (Apple Maps or Google Maps) which then gives them the ability to have it act as a Sat Nav. This is good UX for providers to be able to use it to find the location, which wouldn't work if they have an interactive map, as it wouldn't open externally. We had this feature in our previous native iOS app and it was popular with providers as when they are out and about, they can quickly get an idea of ​​where the customer is located and plan their work diary accordingly.

*Customer Images*: I can confirm that we want to disable the ability for customers to have images and keep the feature for providers.





Still awaiting confirmation:

Customer Notification Permissions: I am still discussing this with Saul but a potential solution might be to split the permissions in the account between service emails and marketing emails? SMS notifications are service only (again, we may have to explain this in writing in the account). Will confirm this with Saul fully after we discuss it.

*GDPR text:* As above, I am waiting for confirmation from Saul on this, but the line of text will read something like: "Under GDPR, you must ensure you have consent from your references for Sorted House to contact them."

I propose to change the implementation of work status management.
 Move the status management logic from the front completely to the back.
 From the back, the front will receive the name of the available actions, depending on the status of the work.

These actions will be sent to the {color:#de350b}`actions`{color} field as an array. They will be inside the object either {color:#de350b}`Job`{color} or {color:#de350b}`JobQuote`{color} received by GET request to ***/api/v1/records/:job_id/model =Job*** for Customer and ***/api/v1/records/:job_quote_id/model=JobQuote*** for Provider.

The format for {color:#de350b}actions{color} would be like this:
 **"actions"=>[\\{"complete"=>"Complete"}, \\{"cancel"=>"Cancel Job"}]**

where {color:#de350b}"cancel"{color} is the key that will need to be sent back to the backend if the user has selected this action.
 and {color:#de350b}"Cancel Job"{color} is the title to display the action on the front.

The front will send a PATCH request to the back specifying the user's chosen `action` to the following routes:
 *`/api/v1/customer_jobs/:job_id`* for Customer,
 *`/api/v1/provider_jobs/:job_quote_id`* for Provider.

Response parameters to comply with a single standard must be sent to
 in this form:
 for the Provider:
 `

{data:

{ attributes:     \{ action: "cancel" }}

}`
 for Customer:
 `

{data:

{ attributes:     \{ action: 'cancel',    job_quote_id:   }}

}`

There is also a proposal to send the text of the questions to be displayed on the front, depending on the status, so that in the future it can be taken out to the admin panel for management.
 In addition to this, it is proposed to pass the color of the buttons for `action`.

actions: \{ { 'yes': 'Yes give me more', 'style' : 0} , \{ 'no': 'No, thank', 'style': 1 } }

where 'yes' is action, that is sent back.

'Yes give me more' - button title
Style - button style
job_message: 'Show me on page'
Button styles :
0 = positive

1 = negative
2 = neutral.

 At the same time, Admin could pause/unpause the provider?
 When the Provider is paused by Admin, should he/she be able to login?

Currently the admin can activate and deactivate the Provider, which is similar to pause functionality.
 However, the Provider can't pause himself/herself.

My estimation is about 2 hours.
from admin panel we can use our Deactivate/Activate buttons we have already

From Iain
Hi @vasily toropchin - Please see below our answers to your questions:
Q:Do we need to keep the history of pausing interval?
A:We just need to know what date the provider paused their account if their account is on pause, so no need for a full history.

Q:Do we need to give the opportunity to a provider to select until when the account is paused? Or should it be simple pause?
A:Yes, we need to have a calendar option for the provider to select a date when they want the pause to end.
We need to know in the back end if the provider is paused. We would also need a monthly update notification send to the paused provider to remind them they are on pause, giving them the option to un-pause immediately or remain on pause.

{code:java}
#!/usr/bin/env bash

#SSH username
CONN_USER=ec2-user
#SSH hostname
HOSTNAME=52.56.186.127
#DUMP_NAME
DUMP_FILE=SH-dump-$(date +%m-%d-%Y).sql


create_dump() {
local DB_USER=$(docker exec backend env | grep POSTGRES_USER | cut -d '=' -f 2)
local DB_PASSWD=$(docker exec backend env | grep POSTGRES_PASSWORD | cut -d '=' -f 2)
local DB_HOST=$(docker exec backend env | grep DB_HOST | cut -d '=' -f 2)
local DB_NAME=$(docker exec backend env | grep POSTGRES_DB | cut -d '=' -f 2)
    
    docker exec -t backend /bin/bash -c "PGPASSWORD=$DB_PASSWD pg_dump -h$DB_HOST -U$DB_USER $DB_NAME" > $DUMP_FILE
}


echo "Create dump, please wait..."
ssh -T $CONN_USER@$HOSTNAME "$(declare -f create_dump);DUMP_FILE=SH-dump-$(date +%m-%d-%Y).sql; create_dump"
echo "Download dump"
scp $CONN_USER@$HOSTNAME:~/$DUMP_FILE ./
echo "Delete dump"
ssh -T $CONN_USER@$HOSTNAME "rm -f $DUMP_FILE"

Committed all changes. Problems that we had:
- 10 minute timespan generated too many itrations
- because of timezone setting we got all data from mongo 7 hours before needed
- sizes of objects vary too much - from 20b to several Mb
- a lot of possible solutions were cut off because of server version/driver version/account permissions
- Mongo and PHP documentations are very bad

[~kalashnikovisme] there is one issue with password validation. It is not validated during updates from admin panel, as a result when we activate a provider the password becomes nil. If switch validation than it is not activated or updated from the Admin panel.
 If I remove the password field from the provider form then everything works as expected. But in this case provider could not be created from the admin panel.

So the issue seems to be related with the form, as soon as there is a password property present it writes nil to password_digest if no password provided. If I enforce the password validation (not only on create) than it won't pass any updates from admin panel.

Magento is working fine and I can't reproduce this issue in local environment, however I was able to reproduce it on our staging. How it works:
 # push from kelly
 # product saved in magento
 # after 1 minute indexing occurs
 # after indexing cache will be cleared (if needed)

Normally there is no need to clean cache manually, as this will happen in step #4, but we are currently using multiple instances. So step #3 and #4 happens on instance #2, while magento works on instance #1. Cache is cleared on instance #2 and we don't see new product in catalog until admin manually refreshes the cache on instance #1.

As a temporary solution I changed index mode to "update on save" on production. It means that indexing will happen "on the fly" on the instance #1, after push from kelly, and admin doesn't need to clear cache manually.

dear [~denis.petrov]. I think we need to define a long-term solution for this issue:
_ What happend if i published 100 or more course in a day => System still can index and show course on edumall.vn.
_ Changed index mode to "update on save" on production have make any problem with another feature?

[~tungtt5],
 1. 100 courses in a day is not a problem for current magento, even with "update on save".
 2. "update on save" is what you originally had. We changed it to "update on schedule" a few weeks ago for optimization purposes, but now I see we need to do some changes in infrastructure to make it work as it should. Speaking about problems, "update on save" is totally fine, unless you have huge catalog with dozens of content managers who constantly change something through admin panel/api (which is not our case right now). So, we can live with "update on save" for now, and should return to it later, when infrastructure will be ready.
 3. try to push new course on production, to confirm it works.

[~leonov.rs@gmail.com] [~alec@topica.asia] [~kirill] [~minhnh3@topica.edu.vn] to show the blog as required in this ticket and here https://jira.topica .vn/browse/EVAB-784 (related ticket) Please do the following in Magento Admin:

1. Go to the *Content > Better Blog > Configurations > MAGEPLAZA EXTENSIONS > Better Blog* and set up this:
    1.1 *Display author* as *No*
    1.2 *Date format* as *d/m/Y (19/06/2020)*
    1.3 *Blogs per Page Allowed Values* as *12*
2. On this configuration page open tab *Monthly Archive* and set the field *Enable Monthly Archive* as *No*
3. If you want to get rid of all topics and not to show them, please delete all of them here *Content > Better Blog > Manage Topics* .

[~kirill] Now you can disable blog links from admin panel. So just go to the Content > Better Blog > Configuration > General
There you can find 2 options:
1. Show Blog Link in Top Menu
2. Show Blog Link in Footer links

Set them as Yes to show blog links or No to disable.
 !screenshot.png|thumbnail!

There are 2 different footer blocks in magento. One was created in admin panel and the socond in codebase. So the configuration in admin panel just disable it in codebase.
To disable second footer we need to go in admin there Content > Elements > Blocks > Find block with id "footer" and delete there the link for blog.
Please see my screenshots.
 !screenshot(2).png|thumbnail! !screenshot(1).png|thumbnail!

[~anvt4@topica.edu.vn]

Downloaded the app from the Play market, and this course displaying with a discount.

[~denis.petrov]

Our assumption is the Magento cache is breaking some how this logic. Here is the flow:
 * mobile app is calling java service [https://git.edumall.io/ecommerce/magento-mobile-api]
 * this Java service is calling Magento REST API. Here is the list of all endpoint for Mage [https://git.edumall.io/ecommerce/magento-mobile-api/blob/master/eco-run/eco-api-middleware/src/main/java/vn/ edu/topica/eco/api/middleware/constant/MagentoConst.java]
 * The real base URL example is this: [https://edumall.vn/rest/V2/mobile/categories]

If there is cache enabled for /rest/* route, then please disable it.

*Example:*

Request details:
 * POST [https://magento-staging.edumall.vn/rest/V2/mobile/customer/product-owner|https://magento-staging.edumall.vn//rest/V2/mobile/customer/product- owner?middleware_test=1591600637]
 * HEADERS: Authorization / Bearer rsiqzug3252sh6wperwsy0ekv54pzh65
 * PARAMS: access_token / 5cbef1ba9ec1360985000a581591011492f132

course details:
 * code: HienNT.01
 * id: 11

User details:
 * id: 5cbef1ba9ec1360985000a58
 * email: [uiza18050423@edumall.vn|mailto:uiza18050423@edumall.vn]
 *phone_number: 0948170098



With [~Pavel Pushkarev] we have bought a course() on staging using IOS app but after the successful payment it still was looking unbought.

I checked magento-mobile-api service used by IOS app and found that it made a request(see above) to Magento. magento-mobile-app tried to get bought courses for user(user token is in params section above), but Magento responses with an empty array, that's why course looked unbought in the app.



In magento-mobile-api I also found the following related to all Magento links:

[https://git.edumall.io/ecommerce/magento-mobile-api/blob/master/eco-run/eco-api-middleware/src/main/java/vn/edu/topica/eco/api/middleware /model/support/config/MagentoConfig.java#L26]



Please follow up with this case.

Magento is working correctly. After applying new rule, both frontend and api will send old prices until reindexing occurs. Magento re-indexes invalid indexers every minute. Indexing time of catalogrule_rule and catalog_product_price depends on: number of active price rules, rules complexity, number of products, server resources. In local env it takes 2 minutes to complete.

So this could happen if magento-mobile-api and/or mobile application requested prices from magento before the new rule was applied or during reindexing, after the new rule was applied. And stored this request in a local cache for some time.

[~Yann], [~alec@topica.asia], [~anvt4@topica.edu.vn]

{panel:title=Comment from Emir}
hello, I won’t be able to go tomorrow, not very good with health. I'll just write down the points that need to be done so that there are no jambs.

1) linter and formatting

You need to configure the linter using the following configs: eslint-config-airbnb, eslint-config-prettier, eslint-plugin-react-perf.
Add a hook for auto-formatting through Prettier (pretty-quick with husky) and linter check (I already showed Alice, she already had to do this in her project)
Add a linter check to the pipeline, failed = failed.

And at the same time, it is very important to check that linter errors are not just picked up and disabled line by line.

2) Garbage in the project

It is necessary to remove absolutely everything that is not used. Under clean. Judging by the project, you should only have:
- react
- linters/formatting
- some css tools
- layout
- router

And that's it. Some utilities, cool things for imports, stores have not been given to you at all.

3) Project structure

Already a million times they came up with things like Atomic, etc. Have a look / revise / decide how best to structure the code.

4) dock
add documentation. Just by describing what you use and most importantly, what for, you will understand what is needed and what is not.


If you do these four points, then immediately consider that you have solved the jambs from the audit, and in the future this will help you screw up less.
It is also worth arranging a post-mortem why this happened and discussing it with Vlad. Perhaps you need help.
{panel}

# Course promos are set in Magento admin panel
# Promos are set for some date ranges (for example, from 13th to 15th of May)
# SOMETIMES these promos just stop working and the price is returning to the original (it occurs after Magento deployments)
# The default price is coming from Kelley
#In this case, the content team is trying to clean the cache

How re-index is going:

# Index: Magento admin > System > Index management
# Clear cache: Magento admin > System > Cache management
# Clear cache for mobile app: http://ecommerce-magento-mobile-api-middleware.tst.edumall.io/swagger-ui.html#!/cache45controller/clearCacheDataForProductTeamUsingGET
Promotions are set here: https://admin.edumall.vn/admin/catalog_rule/promo_catalog/index/filter/bmFtZT0xMyUyRjUmZnJvbV9kYXRlJTVCbG9jYWxlJTVEPWVuX1VTJnRvX2RhdGUlNUJsb2NhbGUlNUQ9ZW5fVVM=/formkGhY0
There was a problem with identities of "Edumall Product Section Widget". The problem has been fixed. No longer need to manually clear the cache to see new prices on the home page.

*Report:*

Starting working on the task by checking the endpoint:
 * http://ecommerce-magento-mobile-api-gateway-staging.tsts.edumall.io/api/v1/course/preview/detail

*Next Step:*

Find the problem

*Next Step:*

Connect to staging db and check if the course belongs to user

*Report:*

Mysql db on staging used by magento-mobile-api is empty.

I found that magento-mobile-api doesn't store any information about courses.

It calls [https://magento-staging.edumall.vn/rest/V2/mobile/customer/product-owner?middleware_test=timestamp_in_milliseconds] instead.**

Request example:

POST [https://magento-staging.edumall.vn/rest/V2/mobile/customer/product-owner?middleware_test=timestamp_in_milliseconds]

Headers: Authorization / Bearer MAGENTO_TOKEN

Params: access_token / [TOKEN from mobile request to magento-mobile-api from Authorization header]



Request returns empty[]

*Next Step:*

Investigate why does the request return empty array.

Cooperate with IOS dev Pavel so we could buy a course and try with new token

*Report:*

Event with the new token POST request to [https://magento-staging.edumall.vn/rest/V2/mobile/customer/product-owner?middleware_test=timestamp_in_milliseconds] returns empty array

*Report:*

I went through each line of code for endpoint [https://magento-staging.edumall.vn/rest/V2/mobile/customer/product-owner?middleware_test=timestamp_in_milliseconds]

and found that it compares user's courses list with the received courses list from Magento.

It receives an empty array from Magento atm that's why *is_owned* attribute equals *false* now and button in mobile apps showing as unbought.

I extended the existing task for Magento developers with the case above.

LInk to the comment: https://jira.topica.vn/browse/EVAB-703?focusedCommentId=119028&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-119028

*Next Step:*

Blocked by EVAB-703

*Report:*

With Magento developer Denis we found that staging Magento uses production uid tokens.

In Magento configs I changed production LMS base url to staging LMS base url.

To test it helped I asked IOS developer Pavel to buy a course, so could we check the result.

*Next Step:*

Wait for Pavel's response.

*Report:*

I have an access to staging Magento database, so I'm going to manually create missing course and check if it helps

*Next Step:*

Connect to staging db and create missing course manually

*Report:*

I checked and found that needed courses are present in Magento, so discrepancy happens between LMS and Magento data.

*Next Step:*

Connect to staging LMS and check courses

*Report:*

I checked lms and found that it takes courses from jackfruit database as pikamon.

So, I had to check pikamon too.

I found that bought courses were not saving for users due to validation erros.

I fixed the error here:

[https://git.edumall.io/tcs/pikamon/merge_requests/883]

ans

[https://git.edumall.io/tcs/pikamon/merge_requests/884/diffs]

*Next Step:*

Test on staging

[https://git.edumall.io/tcs/pikamon/merge_requests/88|https://git.edumall.io/tcs/pikamon/merge_requests/884]5

But it is helping after all, so we continue to investigate.

Checked all sidekiq workers whether they consume too much resources or not. Sidekiq was fine and we didn't notice huge memory consumption by it. We checked unicorn server and its configs. During the timeout we didn't see that unicorn consumes too much memory however it wasn't giving a response so afterwards we decided to increase the number of unicorn workers to 9 and reduced the request timeout speed from 600 sec to 30 sec. It helped now. If this issue happens again we're going to increase the number of unicorn workers and see how it affects the memory and plan our next steps

[~alexander.medvedev]
## Get Services By Category
**GET** `GET /api/v1/services_by_category`
params
```
\{category_id: integer}
```

As for JobCreation:
## Create Job (with Customer)
**POST** `/api/v1/records?model=Job`
Params structure:
```
\{data:
\{ attributes:
\{
customer_id: integer
service_id: integer
title: string
cancelled_description: nil (string value),
limit_reached: integer
provider_fee: decimal,
time frame: integer
values: string (so far is not used),
job_type: string (so far is not used)
}
}
}
```

Regarding today's problem in bifrost_tl. Few points to mention. As i understood the problem solved by removing foreign_key associated with _transaction_id field of transaction_deatils table and making it being nullable
 If you look here [https://git.edumall.io/edumalltl/bifrost_tl/blob/master/db/schema.rb#L69]
 [https://git.edumall.io/edumalltl/bifrost_tl/blob/master/gateway/app/models/gateway/transaction_detail.rb#L4] you can see that _transaction_id field of transaction_details table refers to id field of transactions table but it's being made on active record level not in database level.

Looking at Rails migrations we have this migration [https://git.edumall.io/edumalltl/bifrost_tl/blob/master/db/migrate/20160413035230_transaction_details.rb#L11] where references :_transaction, index: true - that just creates _transaction_id field and creates an index without creating foreing_key on database level.
 In order to foreign key to be created for that column we should have also added "foreign_key: true" option to that line of code but it wasn't. Apart from it there are no any other migrations which could create a foreign key for _transaction_id column.

Also i looked at db schema locally from master branch which should be exactly the same as in production
 apart from data. And there is a following scenario:



!image-2020-05-29-19-14-50-405.png!

!image-2020-05-29-19-14-59-489.png!

There are no *existing foreign keys on database level* as it can be seen in both screenshots. Which fully corresponds to what we have in Rails migrations.

All that information lead us that this foreign key was created directly from mysql shell, which couldn't be done accidentally :)) , and also is bad for the following reason.
 All foreign keys should be created via ActiveRecord migrations it's Rails way of doing things.
 For more info how this may have happened mysql logs have to be investigated.

First of all, full bug list landed here: [https://jira.topica.vn/issues/?jql=labels%20%3D%20apps]



During tests of both mobile apps I found a lot of bugs. I grouped it by Priority and user's affecting:

High-level issues, which blocked users:

EVAB-577 When I register a new user and put to email field any symbols (like +, -'-', etc) or upper-case letters (like TestUser@..) I got green check on mobile screen, but when registration is completed - user do not created and I can't login into app.

EVAB-578 - As I understood, banners is a marketing tool. But no one banner not clickable - just images

EVAB-623 - When I open course with broken video - app go to freeze and I can't return to courses catalog.

EVAB-609 - Sometimes learning screen not working. When I click on second button (about profile) - black splash screen do not hided and app go to freeze. I can't do anything more - courses not open, cart not working, et cetra

EVAB-610 - Learning screen showing randomly on part of test executions.

EVAB-621 - One of the ugly problems. When I want to finish my order into cart and try to fill address form - I can't select no one input, it is blocked for me.

Medium-level issues:

EVAB-567 - Some part of code send error (provided on ticket description) to log, but it is not affected program execution

EVAB-568 - When I add 3 courses on list I see such case - wrong align and spaces around last course

EVAB-565 - For example, when I enter into course detail and request to backend failed - I can share link

EVAB-579 - On desktop I see full list of sub-topics of course, which consists of full counter and FULL list of topics. But on mobile always 3 chapters showing. Total time and count of parts do not show too

EVAB-580 - No one item into cart not clickable. On desktop I can move to the next page



Low level issues:

EVAB-564 - Developers who made app do not implemented connection issues exceptions, and when I switch off mobile/wifi connection - no one message not showing, app working badly



finally. Right now application have a lot of minor and major bugs. This things does not allow us to conclude that this application will be useful and effective for end users. Perhaps we will get a certain number of failures due to non-working functionality. The overall experience of using both applications is bad.

#!/bin/bash

cat > config/database.yml <<EOF

default: &default
  adapter: postgresql
  encoding: utf8
  pool: <%= ENV.fetch("RAILS_MAX_THREADS") { 5 } %>
  host: <%= ENV.fetch("DB_HOST") { } %>
  username: <%= ENV.fetch("POSTGRES_USER") { } %>
  password: <%= ENV.fetch("POSTGRES_PASSWORD") { } %>
  pool: 5
  timeout: 5000

development:
  <<: *default
  database: <%= ENV.fetch("POSTGRES_DB") { } %>

test:
  <<: *default
  database: <%= ENV.fetch("POSTGRES_DB") { } %>

EOF

#migration
rails db:create db:migrate db:seed

exec "$@"

Provider information

The following information is required to create a Provider, the bullet points are provided in order of signup, so the Provider would enter the company information first, then the contact information...etc.
 * company information (information collected through the 'company' form)
 * primary contact (information currently held in the 'provider form').
 * service information (what services they offer) more than one service can be included. (not included in the admin as yet)
 * location information, more than one location can be included. (information collected through the 'location' form)
 * vetting information and status of vetting (information collected through the 'vetting' form)



Any questions please post here.
A question. Does the 'document type' menu option give a list of 'available' documents for vetting, or provide a history of vetted documents?

Vetting

It's not clear how vetting works within the admin. So I've updated a user story for vetting

User story for vetting

As a user I want to be able to vet a provider by checking their business documentation and experience. That makes sure that all the providers that are available to 'customers' offer a legitimate service.

As a user I want to be able to select the document type, upload that document, and confirm that the document has been checked and is valid. Each provider needs to have three valid vetted documents.

As a user I need to see the history of vetted documents for each provider, so I can verify the vetting process was correct.

# 1. After registration, the provider will be able to add or change information in his profile. In this case, we make the related documents as unviewed and through the after save callback we send the provider a notification that its information is under consideration, and we also send the information to the admin. Those. the situation when the provider is activated and a new document is added. When a notification appears in the admin panel for these cases.
2. After a year, we change the vetting_state of the provider to notify the admin. In this case, we do not change the statuses of related documents. And in the admin panel there is a check for an unviewed provider, but with associated verified documents.
 # 3. {color:#1d1c1d}vetting_state is the state that is responsible for verification. {color}

Now in English
1. After signing up, a Provider could add or change his information in his profile. In case of change, we marked all changed document as 'unviewed' and with a help of `after_save` call back we alert the Provider that the information is under review, as well as send notification to Admin. In other words, it is a case when Provider is active and a document is added later. In this case, alert should be present in the admin panel.
2. Provider will have a `vetting_state` that indicates its vetting status. After 12 months we change Provider vetting_state to `unviewed` and notify the Admin. However, the relevant documents' vetting status is not changed. In this case, in the Admin panel there is an alert for `unviewed` Providers.
3. Vetting_state - it is only the status of Provider and his related documents that is responsible for verification, but not for displaying information or blocking the Provider.
remove vetting state for a provider, leave vetting state for documents

application build plan:

1 - clone a project from scratch from branch 3.1.0 to a new folder
 2 - go to the folder with the project and install the Carthage dependencies "{{carthage update --platform ios}}"
 3 - Do not update Pods, the problem with UizaSDK in them
 4 - Open the project with "EduMall.xcworkspace", execute Creal then Build the project.

[@Iain|https://sortedhouse-maddevs.slack.com/team/UM47ZDRE2], [@Saul G|https://sortedhouse-maddevs.slack.com/team/UM3UT9GCF] and [@Andy Burrell|https: //sortedhouse-maddevs.slack.com/team/UM47ZD9BQ]hi guys. I've got a question. There is a ticket https://pm.maddevs.co/browse/SOR-93 regarding Pro-forma invoice. The question is related to functionality. Do you want to issue inoice separately from payments? In other words, the invoice is an issue before any payments made? And they payments are done based on the invoice? Or invoice is issued after payment was completed and it shows the paid data?
Will you please clarify the functionality of this?

[Iain|https://app.slack.com/team/UM47ZDRE2] [2 hours ago|https://sortedhouse-maddevs.slack.com/archives/CLQM6JGM9/p1590481925007300?thread_ts=1590469880.004900&cid=CLQM6JGM9]

[@vasily toropchin|https://sortedhouse-maddevs.slack.com/team/UML73QE78] these aren't invoices, they are payment receipts. They are only issued after a payment has been made by a provider to Sorted House. The information on them will show the total amount that the provider has paid.

I still see problems with IAP 2:
1 - The course is not marked as purchased and can be bought many times
2 - The check for validation from apple is sent from the application to the backend, if for some reason the check didn't reach the backend, I think that the user's money will be withdrawn and of course it's not bought, then we need to check and fix it.

Tried to add non-renewable purchase, as it turned out, it is impossible to make purchases with the same bundle identifier, but then we can restore the purchase through the apple.

Trying to research another way to restore the purchase if backend didn't receive the receipt.

There are 2 solutions to the problem:
1 - Implement a check record from the application side if it has not to send validation and then send it to the backend. If the user has a bad Internet connection, then processing will not be executed.
2 - On the backend side, have the entire flow of the payment. - In my opinion a good solution to the problem.

There was a question with a choice of type of purchase in apple, consumable/ not consumable.

The pluses of a consumable payment is that we attach the rate to the amount and register it in apple, and adding only new amounts in the IAP.
The cons of a consumable payment, cannot be restored, can be bought again from the IAP.

The pluses are not consumable payment, you can restore, you can not buy again, with a second purchase, apple says that the purchase was completed.
The cons of a not consumable payment, you need to register each course with apple, and each time keep the list of courses that should be registered with apple up to date.

Hello! Please pay attention to this comment how to set up this task on production.
So to make this blog working correctly do the following:
1. Go to the admin here *Content > Better Blog > Configuration* and set this fields in *General tab*:
   1.1. Delete *URL Suffix* not to show .html in the end of URL.
   1.2. Set *Display Blogs Mode* as *GridView*
   1.3. set *Choose blog's color* as *#3e3d3c*
   Open *Comments tab* and set:
  1.4. *Type of comment *as *Disable Completely*
  Open tab *Social Sharing* and set:
  1.5. *Enable* as *No*
  Open section *Blog Home Page Open Graph* and set all fields for open graph tags. Image should be this value
https://dvch1hlupt.cdn.hostvn.net/default/default-thumbnail.png

See screenshot !screenshot (2).png|thumbnail! !screenshot(1).png|thumbnail! !screenshot.png|thumbnail!

2. Open Content > Better Blog > Manage Tags > open tag:
Set this values ​​to show open graph and meta tags as shown on screenshot
 !screenshot(3).png|thumbnail!

3. Open Content > Better Blog > Categories > open category
Set everything as show on the screenshot

1. Price should use ISO 4217 (VND)
 2. Item subtitle - in the template it uses correctly, added category name length 10 - 30 symbols;
 3. Item description - it is product description too, but these attributes will be shown in ads, so length should be 10 - 30 symbols.

*Example*:
Item Title: Sedan;
Description: Best Selling Sedan
Subtitle: At your Tempe dealership

Before the deploy, turn on something for the Radik
https://jira.topica.vn/browse/EVAB-429

1. Close production, manually.
 2. Switch on autoscaling disk for base and multi-az.
 3. Change the target group for the admin.
 4. Remove the custom url for sitemap.
 4. Remove redirect from http to https.
 5. Start the build production.
 6. Wait until the deploy is over.
 7. Check the cache work
 8. Enable proxy from cloudflare
 9. Check the work of the site, check the admin, check the possibility of adding changes.
 10. Check page loading

Fixed display issue with mini cart/wishlist/notification/user menu dropdown (multiple dropdowns at the same time or not open at all).

Job creation and job statuses
1. The work is created by the Customer.
After the Customer has sent a request to create a work, the work will have a status - CREATED.
This is the original status of the job.
2. After that, the search algorithm for a suitable provider is launched to work in automatic mode.
The search algorithm runs every 1 minute (now these settings).
As soon as the algorithm starts, the job status will change to - SEARCHING.
3. If the provider is not found, the work status changes to - PROVIDERS_NOT_FOUND.
The customer will receive a notification that it is not possible to find a provider to work with.
This is one of the final statuses of the work. This work will no longer participate in the search algorithm. Perhaps you should apologize to Customer and offer to try another time.
4. If the provider finds it, then the work status will change to - PROVIDERS_FOUND.
And a job_quote (ala request for execution) is created, which is associated with the job and sent to the provider. The customer also receives a notification that a work invitation has been sent.
The status of the newly created job request (JobQuote) is REQUESTED.
A notification is sent to the provider that a job request has been received, in the body of which there is a link to the job.
We display the presence of a job request to the provider (JobQuote in REQUESTED status).
We show the provider two buttons - ACCEPT or REJECT the job request.
At this stage, we do not expect any action from the Customer, however, on demand, we must show the CANCEL button to the Customer to cancel the work.
4.1. If the provider rejects the invitation, then the job_quote status is REFUSED.
The status of the job itself does not change and remains the same (PROVIDERS_FOUND).
The search for providers continues.
The customer will receive a notification that the job request has not been accepted.
4.2. If the provider accepts the invitation, then the job_quote status = GIVEN.
those. it will be necessary from the Provider's side to send an update to job_quote indicating
prices and status states (give, see the doc).
In this case, the status of the job itself will also change to QUOTED.
The customer will receive a notification that the job offer has been accepted.
At this stage, the Provider has no further actions.
4.3. If the invitation is accepted by the Provider and the Customer is satisfied with the price, then the Customer will need to display two buttons - SHARE INFO and DECLINE.
If the Customer wishes to share his data with the Customer, then he selects SHARE INFO, in which case the job_quote status will change to UNDER_REVIEW. In this case, we display the data to the Provider so that he can contact and discuss the details with the Customer.
The Customer has two buttons DECLINE and AGREE for this work.
If the Customer does not want to work with this Provider, then he will press DECLINE and the job_quote status will change to NOT_CHOSEN.
If the Customer is satisfied with everything and they have agreed with the Provider, the Customer presses on AGREE. In this case, the job_quote status = AGREED.
The status of the job itself will change to CONFIRMED.
In point 4, all manipulations took place with the job_quote object.

APO module better then default, but currently, we need to manually run optimization after each deploy + execute several commands from command line to make it work.

Regarding js optimizarion, I suggest to use builtin functionality. I performed bundle optimization and resulting bundle size is 2 times lower then with standard settings. With this approach we will not rely on 3rd party solution, which is always good, since it does not increase overall system complexity - less possible bugs, less dev time wasted.

From time to time, we may notice that the score is lower/higher than usual. Let's see why this is happening.



*48* The sequence of screenshots in report shows that some images from cdn took longer to load than usual, which affected "Largest Contentful Paint" and lowered the score.

!505_11.png|thumbnail!!505_11_1.png|thumbnail!!505_11_2.png|thumbnail!



*75* The sequence of screenshots in report shows that PageSpeed ​​Worker stopped the task before loading all the images, which affected the overall size of request (~3mb vs 7mb) and increased the score.

[~samat.jukeshov] and [~kairat] here is the endpoint to return provided services by current provider within a location:


 **GET** `/api/v1/provided_services?provider_id=:provider_id&location_id=:location_id`



you should provide a location_id, however in return you'll get all the provided services of the provider which have the same postcode as the sent location_id.

In other words, the provided services are searched for postcode, as location is assigned to a certain service.



As you noticed the endpoint is similar to


**GET** `/api/v1/provided_services?provider_id=:provider_id`

Which returns all provided service for the Provider.
So if no location_id is sent in the request, you'll get all provided services, if `location_id` is present you'll get only services which location has the same postcode.

Design is good, just one question. Since a provider could be a big company who have a number of divisions, they may offer multiple services which different people work for. E.g. they have a garden division who can work in a 50 mile radius of NE32 5JA but also have a plumber who can only work in a 25 mile radius of NE32 5XZ. How is this shown to the provider within their account, so they know the right radius is selected for the right service, or if they want to increase or decrease the radius?

[Iain Dalby|https://app.slack.com/team/UM47ZDRE2] [5:20 PM|https://sortedhouse-maddevs.slack.com/archives/CLQM6JGM9/p1581938408014700]

[@Samat Jukeshov|https://sortedhouse-maddevs.slack.com/team/UM23B5J4Q] and [@Saul G|https://sortedhouse-maddevs.slack.com/team/UM3UT9GCF] - I've just spoken to [@Andy Burrell|https://sortedhouse-maddevs.slack.com/team/UM47ZD9BQ] regarding our conversation on the pictures requiring consent from the customer before upload. We need to stick to our original plan of gaining consent from the customer. Andy reminded me that one of our selling points that we will push once we launch is that our reviews (in the form of photos) can't be faked. If we change to what we discussed this morning, and put our trust in the provider, then we open ourselves up to potential issues.We will speak to our providers once they come on board and tell them that, when they do a job and take photos of it, they should upload them ASAP (ideally when they are with the customer and the job is complete) and then the customer can react to the notification asking them to verify the photos (whether this be by an email link or a link via SMS?) which will help to avoid the customer potentially ignoring/missing the request.We could still keep the disclaimer that Saul wrote, to keep ourselves very safe? there should be a message at the top stating: "All photos in this portfolio are verified by customers and are taken from actual jobs that were completed via Sorted House."We would still like to retain the ability as an Admin to upload photos to a provider's portfolio (which is especially helpful when they are newly registering an account)

Here is the summary of our call and conclusions for current status with Enhanced Ecommerce on 05/25/2020:
 # We have compared last few days with bifrost database and it fits in general numbers (revenue, quantity of transactions etc)!
 # GA EE in EVN works with data discrepancy 3-5% (or even 0% in some cases)

What problems do we have:
 # Because bifrost doesn't see referrer (dr parameter = url source of traffic, if it doesn't have UTM). That's why our organic / SEO traffic goes to direct / none
 # We don't see refunds in GA, but we found last records in database in 2017. It seems not so critical
 # We don't see promocodes in GA, we need [~Yann]'s help to understand how promocodes look in our database

These problems are not critical because we can:
 # Track paid traffic sources and efficiency
 # We see real transactions and revenue

For the closest 3-4-5-6 months this solution is acceptable, but in the future it would be great to improve it by solving these problems.



But we have another big problem: one problem that we have is mess with UTM terms that marketers use now. And internal database see traffic sources in another way.

plan:

1. Increase resources for redis new production - cache.m3.medium
 2. Increase resources in gitlab-ci.yml for web instances and admin, change IT_PROD variable - t3a.xlarge, IT_PROD_ADMIN - t3a.large
 2.1 Remove from userdata changes nginx config
 2.2 Update DB name in PROD_DB_NAME
 2.3 Update prod url PROD_URL
 3. Prepare MR with new changes
 4. Manually change TG for TL-prod-LB with m-mode
 5. In cloudflare direct the edumall.co.th domain to CNAME LA prod"
 ecommerce-magento-PROD-tl-LBF-1547476215.ap-southeast-1.elb.amazonaws.com
 "
 5.1 Direct admin.edumall.co.th to CNAME LA prod

5.2 Update rule LB for admin 80 443

6. Take a snapshot of the current production database.
 7. Run a new instance from production snapshot - make the instance type the same as on the production db.t3.medium
 7.1 Enable asg for disk
 7.2 Enable multi-AZ

7.3 Enable log_bin_trust_function_creators=1 for new prod
 8. Update the variables in Gitlab-ci to connect to the new database, the data to connect take from the current production.
 Do not forget to change DB-HOST
 9. Wait until the new database is complete.
 9.1 Change index prefix
 SELECT * FROM core_config_data WHERE path LIKE "%elas%";
 69 | default | 0 | catalog/search/elasticsearch5_index_prefix | edumall_tl_prod

UPDATE core_config_data SET value = 'edumall_tl_newprod' WHERE config_id=69;

9.2 Create user for prod DB connect

mysql -h ecom_master_user -p'ecom_master_user-edumall' ecommerce_mysql < <MY_QUERY
 CREATE USER 'ecommerce_user_prod'@'%' IDENTIFIED BY '43zzPQcTBU2LJe6n';
 GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON ecommerce_tl.* TO 'ecommerce_user_prod'@'%';
 FLUSH PRIVILEGES;

Create Snapshot new DB with name ecommerce-magento-tl-newprod-database-snapshot-create-date-1111

10. Run the build and the deploy from the prod branch.

11. Wait when production deployed
 12. Create a user on the product
 sudo php /srv/www/edumall/bin/magento admin:user:create --admin-user maduser --admin-password passwd --admin-email example@exam.io --admin-firstname maduser --admin-lastname maduser

13. Enable cloudflare proxy

14. Check the work of the CDN in the admin and check the urls for other services. Lms, Thresh production
 15. Verify authorization via SSO
 16. Check the addition of the product to the cart
