Permission check flow:

* {{manage_collaborators}} workspace permission
* {{lesson->organisation_id === user->active_organisation_id}}

If user can't pass first check - 401.
If user can pass first, but can't pass second - 401.
Otherwise user can manage collaborators in current lesson.

In the response {{lessons/{id}/state}} comes {{organization_id}} (to which the lesson belongs).
Collaborator management - read adding + removing.

Check flow (permission) for the management of collaborators:

# If lesson's {{organisation_id}} == teacher's {{active_organization_id}} - check permissions (can/can not {{invite_collaborators}}).
# If the {{organization_id}} of the lesson \!= {{active_organization_id}} of the teacher - disable managing collaborators.

The second point of the flow is that the teacher *cannot* manage collaborators if he was called as a collaborator in the lesson, but *can* manage them if the lesson is in the workspace where the teacher is editor/owner, provided that this workspace is now active for the teacher.



Through this flow, it is impossible to handle changing the active workspace on another tab, as well as removing the teacher from the workspace.
This issue should be addressed comprehensively, together with [https://lumicislate.atlassian.net/browse/TILT-8224|https://lumicislate.atlassian.net/browse/TILT-8224|smart-link] , [https:/ /lumicislate.atlassian.net/browse/TILT-8226|https://lumicislate.atlassian.net/browse/TILT-8226|smart-link]

Now the invited collaborator can add/remove collaborators in the shared template if he has editor permission or higher.
The problem is that a teacher can change the current workspace to his own, and he will automatically have the ability to add / remove collaborators, regardless of any permissions (in his case, he turns out to be an admin).

You need to remove the {{share}} and {{delete collaborator}} buttons on the canvas for the current template's non-owner or return 403 for them.
task requirements has been discussed with [~accountid:557058:7ae9d263-27ab-437c-9306-d8fad371f87c]

Update:

* If the lesson is physically from the teacher's current active workspace (lesson ->organization_id === teacher->active_organization_id) - look at the permission and allow/not allow collaborators to be managed.
* In all other cases - prohibit.

* token - no

3. Invite collaborate to lesson template(*outdated*)::

* type_id - 4
* message - Some One {{invited you to collaborate in lesson template.}}
* target - Template: My Best Template
* link (if any) - no
* token - no

[~accountid:5d41b93199fa080dac248d12] these three types of notifications are essentially the same: 1, 3, 4. You can combine them into one type

4. Invite to team(*outdated*):

* type_id - 5
* message - Some One {{invited you to the team.}}
* target-Team: My Best Team
* link (if any) - no
* token - no

[~accountid:5d41b93199fa080dac248d12] Invite to team - you can get rid of

5.Unshare lesson:

* type_id - 16
* message - Some One {{unshared the lesson with you.}}
* target - Lesson: My Best Lesson
* link (if any) - no
* token - no

6. Unshare template(*deprecated*):

* type_id - 17
* message - Some One {{unshared the template with you.}}
* target - Template: My Best Template
* link (if any) - no
* token - no

[~accountid:5d41b93199fa080dac248d12] Unshare lesson and Unshare template can also be combined and leave only Unshare lesson

7. HR update|reject|approve document:

* type_id - 15
* message - Some One reject/update/approve {{your onboarding document.}}
* {{record_status}}-reject/update/approve
* target - Documents: {{Document management}}
* link (if any) - {{teacher/account/document-management}}
* token - no

8. Workspace invitation:

* type_id - 18
* message - Some One accepted/declined {{your invitation}}
* target - Workspace: {{Workspace name}}

* link (if any) - {{no}}
* token - no

9. Workspace invitation with action:

* type_id - 19
* message - Some One {{invited you to join the workspace.}}
* target - Workspace: {{Workspace name}}

* link (if any) - {{no}}
* token - yes

10. Workspace invitation with action finished:

* type_id - 19
* message - Some One {{invited you to join the workspace.}}Invite accepted.
* target - Workspace: {{Workspace name}}

* link (if any) - {{no}}
* token - yes

 2. Lesson in progress:

To solve this task, I want to use laravel feature called [Seeders|https://laravel.com/docs/8.x/seeding]. We already use it for populating database in tests. For populating data for developers/staging environment we can have standalone database seeder class, to prevent running collisions in test runs. When we can populate all data in staging/dev with single command like {{php artisan db:seed --class=StagingSeeder}}

Possible problems:

* Some data added through migrations, may be better to move it to default seeders for better control.
* Some tables should have hundreds of rows with related data, it can be tricky or tedious to add it manually.

The draft plan is:

* Add missing data seeders.
* Update current seeders where not enough data.
* Create database seeder class for dev/staging.

Import {{standards}} with this query:

{code:sql}select standards.id,
       name,
       description,
       code,
       standard_group_id,
       standard_level_id,
       created_at,
       updated_at,
       standard_category_id
from standards
         inner join (select id from standard_categories where user_id is null) sc
                    on standards.standard_category_id = sc.id
         inner join (select id from standard_groups where user_id is null) sg on standards.standard_group_id = sg.id;{code}

Copy themes and layout assets to dev s3 backet.

{code:python}import boto3

s3_resource = boto3.resource('s3')

def copy_to_bucket(bucket_from_name, bucket_to_name, file_name):
    copy_source = {
        'Bucket': bucket_from_name,
        'Key': file_name
    }
    s3_resource.Object(bucket_to_name, file_name).copy(copy_source)

I studied the possibilities of our canvas. The problem is that our canvas does not use native Drag-N-Drop([Support|https://caniuse.com/?search=drag%20and%20drop]), but an artificial one. Therefore, this functionality does not work properly on touch devices. During the research, I began to study libraries for React with native Drag-N-Drop. I opted for the React-draggable library. They have a lot of features and functionality, and the use is quite simple and straightforward. I even managed to throw a small example on codesandbox:

[Example|https://chjln.csb.app/]

[An example of all React-draggable features|https://strml.github.io/react-draggable/example/]

There are several problems with the library:

# The library does not have a built-in resize functionality (our current one does)
# Also there is no rotate (in our current one, again)

 In search of a solution to these problems, I came across the following solutions:

[React-resizable|https://strml.github.io/react-resizable/examples/1.html] - allows very flexible resizing of elements

[React-rotatable |https://pjarmalavicius.github.io/react-rotatable/] - allows you to rotate the element (no iPad support, but you can look for an alternative)

Thus, for full work, it will be necessary to replace our old lib with 3 new ones and build their interaction with each other and with the canvas

----

I am attaching a Demo video of the libraries working with the iPad:

[https://www.loom.com/share/92530f7523e3422ca853eb3ac610e21f|https://www.loom.com/share/92530f7523e3422ca853eb3ac610e21f]

[~accountid:557058:7ae9d263-27ab-437c-9306-d8fad371f87c], [~accountid:5b67bcd8e6dba529eefda937], as part of the current task, Roma changed the logic for saving the name of the template and sections, now it works like this:

* The name is saved when pressing Enter or when clicking outside the input field, and not when typing, as it was before
* If the user erases the name completely and presses Enter or clicks outside, then the previously saved value is assigned to the name (same as when pressing esc)

Approved the next logic with [~accountid:70121:78d951cd-952b-49d7-b2fc-0f0edf03b8dc]

{noformat}Save after Blur/Key(Enter)
Cancel after Key(Escape)
If the value is empty - always cancel{noformat}
works on mobile device as well

In {{short-profile}} request added restriction {{workspace_num}}.

If user has plan different to {{free}} - {{workspace_num}} will be {{null}}, that means user can create unlimited amount of the workspaces.

If user has plan {{free}} - {{workspace_num}} will be {{integer}} and corresponds to how many user can create workspace for this moment. If {{workspace_num = 0}}, that means user can't create workspace.

Also, {{PUT /teacher/organization}} will return 403 if user can't create workspace.

{{short-profile}} response:

{no format}...
currency: "gbp"
subscription_restrictions: {
  ...
  template_num: 10
  workspace_num: 1
  video_record_length: 40
  ...
},
...{noformat}

structure example:

{noformat}CLIENT:
    
    // files
    index.ejs
    webpack-public-path.js
    App.jsx
    
    // folders
    teacher/
    admin/
    sitepoint/
    utils/ - @app-utils
    
TEACHER:

    // files
    Routes.jsx
    index.js
    // folders
    configs/ - @app-configs
        api.js
        index.js
        ...
    constants/ - @app-constants
        index.js
        ...
    containers/ - @app-containers
        index.js
        ...
    components/ - @app-components
        index.js(?)
        ...
    hocs/ - @app-hocs
        index.js
        ...
    store/ - @app-store
        actions/ - @app-actions
            types.js
            index.js
            ...
        reducers/
            index.js
            ...
        epics/
            index.js
            ...
        selectors/ - @app-selectors
            index.js
            ....
    styles/ - @app-styles
        index.js
        ...
    pages/ - @app-pages
        index.js
        ...
    
COMPONENT/CONTAINER:

    // example for dropdown
    index.js - export file
    utils.js - extra utils(optional)
    Dropdown.jsx - main file
    Dropdown.styles.js - styles(optional)
    Dropdown.test.js - units(optional)
    // --or--
    __tests__ - tests folder(optional)
    
    
EXAMPLE OF IMPORTS USING aliases:
    
    import { getEntity } from '@teacher-actions;
    import { getDataFromRaw } from '@teacher-utils/getDataFromRaw';
    import Entity from '@teacher-components/Entity';

Roughly speaking, when we delete a lesson, the front crashes if it receives a notification that was associated with this lesson, since the notification will not have fields and, in general, the object of the lesson. For example, “lesson collaboration”, “you were invited to the workspace”, etc.

From the point of view of logic, a notification is something that happened, and deleting it is probably not the best option.

Missing data can be handled by the front, or by the back.
You can refactor notifications so that they write the prepared text + some data and return it to the front (then there will be no problem at all to modify new types of notifications by the front).

Fixed displaying published lessons in Lesson Templates page. They were show there because of misunderstanding of previous requirements when we have to show special icon for published lessons.

Discussed this problem with Dima, we need to hide published lessons, but show this icon on original, which means that this lesson was published.

Currently there is no way to determine if lesson was published. We can't relate published and original lessons. So it's unclear how to show this icon. Need to think more.

Discussed with Gulya and Dima this problem. Decided to add new field to lessons table that will define if lesson was published or not.

We have two options:

# Boolean field to original lesson record with True value. Ex: `is_published`, that means lesson was published
# Add Foreign Key to duplicated lesson record which links to original.

At first case we will not be able to relate two records with each other, but it’s the easiest way to solve the current problem. If {{is_published=True}} then show icon.

The second option is more confusing, because we have multiple places where lesson is duplicated. Need to do more refactoring. But will let us relate records.

I choose first option.

The following was discussed with [~accountid:5b67bcd8e6dba529eefda937] and MadDevs management:

* *Listen to the opinions of the team about the “painful spots” in the project.* Their opinions are far more important than any external analysis. They know their code better than analysts.
* *Systematic backend code review and cleaning.* In some places the same code is found, for example {{/teacher/teams}}. This adds unnecessary things to autoloading and makes it harder to track changes.
* *If the session driver is files, then it should be changed to InMemory / Database.* Files work much longer than other options, and they don't scale well. This should be checked in production.
* *Move to MySQL 8.* Our DevOps stated that in theory there should be no problems. This will allow filtering by JSON fields without the need for PHP loops.
* *Check database queries step-by-step*:
** Check the performance of {{WHERE id IN (SELECT ...)}} versus {{WHERE EXISTS ()}}
*** {{WHERE EXISTS ()}} exits early as soon as it finds the first match. There is no need to complete the fetch / scan of the entire table. But this may depend on particular cases.
** Stop using {{SELECT *}} when all data is not needed. Dragging extra data and wasting time / memory that way.
** Where possible, use BATCH / BULK INSERT instead of planting records one at a time in cycles.

[~accountid:5b67bcd8e6dba529eefda937] also noted that there is a stategically beneficial issue, that wasn't completed previously: *decoupling frontend and backend components*. This would improve developer quality of life and will allow us to boost developer productivity, also make an API data exchange to be expicit.

We are considering to start an implementation during the technical debt sprint in the start of September.
Related thing for me is to test database backup restoration on MySQL 8 local server and report any issues.

Notification flow:

* Registered user has been invited by workspace-admin from invitation modal:
** Teacher will receive “You requested to join in \{workspace-name} workspace” with Accept / Decline buttons.
** On accept, workspace-admin will receive “\{name, profile link} has been accepted your invite request in \{workspace name} workspace“.
** On decline, workspace-admin will receive “\{name, profile-link} has been rejected your invite request in \{workspace name} workspace“.
* Non registered user has been invited via email by workspace admin from modal:
** Send email (need to create mandrill template).
** After registration teacher must be added in workspace.
* Teacher attempts to join from Join to Workspace modal:
** Workspace admin will receive “\{name, profile link} wants to join in \{workspace-name} workspace“ with Accept / Decline buttons.
** On accept, teacher will receive “Join request in \{workspace-name} has been approved“.
** On decline, teacher will receive “Join request in \{workspace-name} has been rejected“.

Most problems related to CPU were fixed in new Edge release [https://github.com/docker/for-mac/issues/3499#issuecomment-678384952|https://github.com/docker/for-mac/issues/ 3499#issuecomment-678384952|smart-link]

I keep facing problem with slow tests running locally on macOS.

Had a working session with Gennady to figure out what's going on. Here is summary.

In latest release of Docker for Mac Edge they changed file sharing system from {{osxfs}} to {{gRPC-FUSE}} which should increase file sharing very much. But I can't see any real difference. Running all current ~480 tests takes about ~20 minutes which is too much time.

We found that turning off debug locally gives good boost. To turn off debug need to run the following command in container: {{mv /usr/local/etc/php/conf.d/docker-php-ext-xdebug.ini /usr/local/etc/php/conf.d/ docker-php-ext-xdebug.ini.disabled }}To turn debug on do the backwards. Gennady will figure out something to making turning on/off debug easier, via environment variables.

But still tests ran much faster on linux machine of Gennady then on macOS. For example unit test {{PreSignUrlRequestTest}} on linux runs for 6ms, on macOS about 300ms. We excluded PHP and CPU from suspects, because PHP image is the same, and other macOS developers with better CPUs have also such a problem. So the reason is still Docker.

By checking docker daemon logs:

{noformat}cd ~/Library/Containers/com.docker.docker/Data/log/host
tail -n 5 -f {vm,host}/*.log{noformat}

we can see such error:

{noformat}time="2020-09-03T15:39:38+06:00" level=error msg="Unable to query mutagen state: list failed: connection error: desc = \"transport: Error while dialing dial unix / Users/belek/.docker/mutagen/daemon/daemon.sock: connect: no such file or directory\""{noformat}

which can leed to this issues threads [https://github.com/docker/for-mac/issues/4655|https://github.com/docker/for-mac/issues/4655|smart-link] & [ https://github.com/docker/for-mac/issues/1592|https://github.com/docker/for-mac/issues/1592|smart-link]

We though that this error happens because we have marked our volumes with {{delegated}} mark and it tries to use Mutagen which is removed. We removed this from compose file, removed volumes and re-run containers.

For checking we took {{\Tests\Feature\Http\Controllers\Teachers\Unit\UnitControllerTest}} with 27 tests. With turned on debug on my machine they pass 26-27 secs tests. Without debug they pass 18-19 secs. But Mutagen related errors still occurres in logs.

All tests pass 5 mins the previous 20 mins.

That is better then nothing. So all macOS developers need to upgrade Docker for Mac to the latest Edge version. Turn off debug, and turn it on only when need to debug.

{quote}It's the action, when a teacher starts activity, it means that every student should have their own phase with the whiteboard toolbar enabled to draw, text etc… to complete teacher's tasks. Teacher can start activity and stop activity. After stopping activity on the student’s side, the whiteboard toolbar should be blocked and all data(drawings, etc) should be stored inside the student's phase. Teacher should see students' phases and check them all. It could be attached to the student's camera view, or it could be a separate module or block with these phases.{quote}

This sounds like an additional functionality which hasn't been discussed earlier.

When students finish their work on a phase or an activity is stopped by a teacher. How will teacher evaluate student work? Teacher won't be able to do this during a lesson, teacher won't have time to do it. Will there be a new screen / functionality where teacher will evaluate work? This mean teacher should grade too which we do not have yet.
”Activity” feature - is very complex and needs to be thought through, at this point this is a meaningless feature request which will do nothing inside the platform.

The most time efficient for the whiteboard feature is [https://zwibbler.com/|https://zwibbler.com/] it costs $3499 USD and it is only whiteboard library. It doesn't include screen broadcasting, chat and recording.

Screen / video broadcasting, chat and lesson recording should be handled by some other tool like Jitsi, BigBlueButton etc.

    - simple variant - just a short text

    - full variant - tooltip with the title, text and two or one action buttons

    - custom variant - tooltip accepts custom markup and handlers as a parameter

2) Full tooltip can contain only two buttons that can be used to set handlers

3) A tooltip can consist of several parts of content which are shown one by one when you click on Next button

4) Tooltip takes the following positions regarding the element:

     - top-left, top, top-right

     - right-top, right, right-bottom

     - bottom-left, bottom, bottom-right

     - left-top, left, left-bottom

5) Tooltip has three color variations

     - Light (White background, dark color)

     - Accent (Primary background, white color)

     - If the tooltip contains a custom layout. The color can be any of the color palette. Also we may change the color for the tooltip corner

6) We can set the width of the tooltip

7) In simple tooltip, the text can be on the center or on the left

8) Need to add a closing delay for tooltip, which triggered on hover

9) Add the ability to hide a ic-close in the top left place of tooltip

10) Tooltip appears only when interacting with an element which it wraps

*Research results:*

* Studied the ability to store components in bit.dev. You can conveniently store them and maintain versioning of each component separately
* Tried to import components from bit to another project. Everything is done very conveniently and without unnecessary problems (you just need to set up the registry and log in to bit)
* Explored the possibility of using the gitlab npm registry. There were problems with the setup. Most likely, the gitlab registry does not support private packages (bit.dev does)
* Wrote a small script to pull all components, everything works, dependencies are pulled up

*After research I tend to use bit.dev as storage for UI-Components*

{code:java}
 - LessonTemplate:getClonedPhaseSections() ---> PhaseSection:createClone
      ->PhaseSection is being cloned
      ->foreach Phase from PhaseSection ---> Phase:createClone
            ->Phase is being cloned
            ->foreach PhaseCommand from Phase ---> PhaseCommand
            ->foreach Activity from Phase ---> Activity:createClone
                 ->Activity is being cloned
                      -> ...............
                 ->foreach Question from Activity ---> Question:createClone
                      ->Question is being created
                      ->foreach QuestionObject in Question ---> QuestionObject:createClone
{code}

What I've done:

* Remove redundant commands in CI job
* Replace docker image building with production php image.
* Isolate all tests with database transactions
* Split environment settings. Now tests run with {{APP_ENV=testing}} and use .env.testing settings in developer and CI runs.
* Fix few tests and code cleanup

Testing structure

Laravel stores tests under the {{tests}} folder. Under the {{tests}} folder, Laravel has two subfolders: {{Feature}} and {{Unit}}.

These terms carry with them implications about the tests. Unfortunately, this is exactly the kind of quagmire you can get stuck in when starting to test. I'm intentionally going to skirt the issue. For today, *tests are tests*. The only distinction I will make is placing Laravel's HTTP Tests under the {{Feature}} subfolder as this is how the example tests are organized.

Organizing Your Tests

On the topic of subfolders, I encourage organizing your tests to mirror the {{app}} folder. So if you are testing the {{app/Http/Controllers/UserController.php}}, you should create the test as {{tests/Feature/Http/Controllers/UserControllerTest.php}}. Mirroring the folder structures avoids confusion on where (or if) a test exists.

[~accountid:5b67bcd8e6dba529eefda937] Here is the old student logic. We need to decide what to do here. Probably, if the user is already authenticated and clicks on the invitation link again, then he should be redirected to the student room without any “go to classes”. And if someone tries to request a url with a non-existent token, then I would throw a 403 or redirect to the login page, not the wrong token.
[~accountid:5cee2d23919eaf0f2135ac64] don't fully understand the problem. Can we sync for 10 minutes?

Agreed to do the next check. If the user is not authorized and the reset token is valid, then we log in and redirect to the student immediately. If the user is not authorized and the token does not exist, then we redirect to the root page with logins. If the user is authorized, then to the student.

After the student has passed the activation of the invite, he is redirected to the student dashboard. Since we cannot login a user from one dashboard to another, the student gets to the login form.

If the token is not correct when going to the invite page, then the user is redirected to the main page with a role selection.
Checked fix. Now the user redirects on the main page and doesn’t confuse when he/she saw Invalid token message previously.

About first error:

We use MySQL 5.7 which supports JSON, but old version of {{"doctrine/dbal": "2.5.13",}} which does support JSON type from 2.6 version [https://github.com/doctrine/dbal/releases /tag/v2.6.0|https://github.com/doctrine/dbal/releases/tag/v2.6.0] . Need to check can this package be updated.

About second problem there is probably typo in model name, because file is called Lessons_State, so as table lessons_states. Getting details from team

DBAL 2.6.0 requires PHP 7.1.0.

*Researched* {{styled-components}} *Summary:*

* We can use styled-components for separate component styles.
* All classnames will be generated automatically
* All styles will be encapsulated
* We can write some part of global styles
* We can use theming and ThemeProvider for customization in the main app(Teacher, etc.)

*Researched storybook. Summary:*

* We can use storybook for our UI-components library
* We can show components and use storybook as documentation to the components
* Storybook can display any states of the component. We can change props/state in the UI-interface
* Storybook also has documentation for the component. We can write and support simple documentation(Description, props) of the component

*Invite* - *flow*

we send the user an email and a URL for the lesson + a token

middleware to point with lesson/template. The token catches, checks for the presence of an object in invite, pulls out mail, searches for a user by mail



*User*

if there is a user, then the middleware throws a user with a lesson on the service (inside it checks for enabled, expired and throws a notification)

After, if logged in → throws to the lesson
if not, we throw on the login

flips to register/token

regatta user

[stack trace]
#0 {main}
"} {noformat}

It appeared after updating to 5.5 and updating the package [https://github.com/staudenmeir/belongs-to-through|https://github.com/staudenmeir/belongs-to-through|smart-link] . changelog for this package [https://github.com/staudenmeir/belongs-to-through/releases?after=v2.4|https://github.com/staudenmeir/belongs-to-through/releases?after=v2 .four]

*Case 2 (fixed)*

After the update, a warning appeared:

{noformat}Warning: Ambiguous class resolution, "App\Http\Controllers\TeacherAdmins\QualificationController" was found in both "/var/www/app/Http/Controllers/Teachers/QualificationController.php" and "/var/www/app /Http/Controllers/TeacherAdmins/QualificationController.php", the first will be used.{noformat}

_Solution_:

Rename the class
A good and common practice is to name the class like the file. This is a simple way to avoid such collisions because two files in the same directory can't have the same name.
[https://stackoverflow.com/a/27938044/3840005|https://stackoverflow.com/a/27938044/3840005]

[~accountid:557058:aa0d475c-712d-4039-803e-4f5df9c3da53] [~accountid:557058:4d51e61f-f264-4dac-b7cd-d45ab512d07e]

I want to clarify something. In general, the flow for pulling notifications from the database is like this ('Teachers\\NotificationController'):

* All notifications are pulled from the logged in user
* Further from notifications, all connections (lesson, initiator, etc.)
* Further filters like seen, created, etc.
* Well, in the end ->get

In fact, all notifications need only the initiator connection, the rest are optional depending on the type of notification. For example, if notification.type_id == 3, then only initiator and lesson are needed

Question:

Is it possible to put a check on the notification type_id and connect certain links within one querybuilder request. Have you had experience with this? For example, eloquent collection has a has() method, with which you can check the presence of a certain field, but I need to check the value

Or all the same, you will first need to pull out all the notifications and then in a separate loop for each implode the necessary relationship

* Read more and searched examples on using collection's has() method
* Tried to implement check on type_id within single querybuilder. Did not work
* Wrote down my problem and asked advice from Gulya, Ulan on how to better deal with it
* Call with Gulya, discussed the overall problem and the ways of how to solve it. Gulya advised me where to look for good examples within the project

* Tried to first retrieve notifications and later in loop check for type_id and implode needed relation
* Fixed issues, though relation was nat adding to notifications collection
* Plus because of this approach latency increased twist, so its not the best solution

* Researched code in responses app within project, found some really good examples, that I could implement in my case
* Researched on using eager loading in loop
* Added new method that takes notifications collection and manually generates json schema only with needed params
* Faced couple issues, handled them
* Reverted everything and updated response by calling the new method
* Tested new solution locally, results are really good. Amount of db queries went down to only 35 and it takes only 350ms. In compliance before it was 650 queries and 4.8 seconds
* Finally understood the idea of ​​eager loading and why it's so useful
* Have been searching the uses of notification endpoint within project, found one more occurrence in front part. Need to investigate it

[~accountid:557058:dc97fe24-bdda-4965-9046-7974ad38ae38] I studied a little how pagination is implemented at the point {{￼/api/teacher/lesson-template}}￼, as it is implemented there with my optimization it will not work. Also studied pagination in Laravel ([https://laravel.com/docs/7.x/pagination#paginating-query-builder-results|https://laravel.com/docs/7.x/pagination#paginating- query-builder-results]). From under the hood, too, will not work, it will be necessary to override'it a little but it is quite feasible. But in extreme cases, you can even do this: When loading the main one, load only the number of notifications, and then when you click on the bell, load all the notifications (on the front at this moment there will just be a loader)

[~accountid:5b67bcd8e6dba529eefda937] Here the situation is as follows: at the moment everything is pretty well optimized (for comparison, the numbers below). Nakylai suggested an option for even greater optimization (a little higher and in the comments). There will need improvements on the back and on the front (it is not yet clear exactly in time).

Question: is it worth doing this now (even more optimization of the notification point), or does it make sense to roll the task (write everything there) and move on to other problematic endpoints?


Optimization results:


* I didn’t look at time in the network, because everything is not accurate there and always relative
* Comparison by queries in the database for pulling notifications and all the necessary links

Previously: ~ 650 requests to the database and 4.8 seconds (payload for 30 notifications 213 thousand characters)
Now: ~ 38 requests to the database and 400 milliseconds (payload for 30 notifications 7 thousand characters)
[~accountid:5b044dd827dd77348bacbf34] according to the numbers, what I see is a good optimization. Put your branch in development, let's test it. In parallel, you can prepare MP.

* Investigated how respinses work in project, read the documentation
* Moved custom notifications method to responses
* Locally tested
* Investigate how request work and how to validate data in requests
* Read the documentation several times([https://laravel.com/docs/5.3/validation#quick-creating-the-controller|https://laravel.com/docs/5.3/validation#quick-creating-the- controller])
* Moved validation from the controller to request.
* At first, it seemed like validation stopped working(was testing in a brpwder). Made a research and understood that everything was working correctly as describe in the doc

{quote}If validation fails, a redirect response will be generated to send the user back to their previous location. The errors will also be flashed to the session so they are available for display. If the request was an AJAX request, a HTTP response with a 422 status code will be returned to the user including a JSON representation of the validation errors.{quote}

* Wrote test on validation fail

Need to hide lessons with “draft” status
[~accountid:557058:7ae9d263-27ab-437c-9306-d8fad371f87c] will create diagram with logic.

Had a long call with Dima and later Vlad joined

First of all defined several main problems:

# Currently, canvas content can be edited in two places: Lesson and Template. It is confusing for teachers and makes them think that editing canvas content in one place will affect the other.
# Currently, we have the functionality of working with lessons and templates collaboratively. This means that teachers are able to add collaborators to their lessons and templates to work together but these two things are being confused again. For instance, teacher 1 is adding a collaborator(teacher 2) to his lesson, but the teacher 2 is searching shared lesson on templates page(the same another way)


How the new flow will work and what changes are gonna be implemented:

# First, we are getting rid of templates term. Now lessons are gonna be “templates“
# Only lessons are gonna be shareable
# Canvas content is going to be editable only in the lesson. The edit wizard will be available in lesson only too(the form where you add/update curriculum, standards, mastery skills, collaborators, etc.)
# Within the class, you are gonna be able to add assignments by copying the current state of a certain lesson.
# If you need to update canvas content in the assignment, you have to delete the assignment, edit the canvas content in the lesson and add new assignment by using updated lesson as a template
# When you click on assignments within the class, you are gonna be able to see the canvas preview only
# The assignment(on class assignments page) will have only two actions: delete an assignment, update the publishing date
# By new design, if you are willing to add assignments and create canvas content from the scratch, there will be a button on the main page(create an assignment from scratch *just example). You will be redirected to the canvas edit page → create the desired lesson content and save it → A New lesson will be created and a copy of that lesson will be added as an assignment to the class that you choose. (Not really sure about this point, can you check please [~accountid:557058:7ae9d263-27ab-437c-9306-d8fad371f87c])

Other key points:

# Dring implementing the new endpoints for the new flow, optimize them from the beginning
# The new flow described below can be associated with google docs. Imagine you are working on a google doc file(It is a lesson) → Later you are exporting your current work to pdf file(it is kinda you freeze you progress to uneditable version and it is an assignment). You cannot edit the exported pdf file and if you have typos/mistakes there, you have to first edit them on a google doc and later export it to pdf again

  before_script:
    - echo "Building images"
  script:
    - $(aws ecr get-login --no-include-email --region $REGION)
    - docker build -t $API_REPOSITORY_URL:$IMAGE_TAG -t $API_REPOSITORY_URL:$CI_ENVIRONMENT_NAME --build-arg WS_URL=$TEACHERLY_WS_URL $TEACHERLY_API_BUILD_ARGS -f docker/Dockerfile-api-prod .
    - docker push $API_REPOSITORY_URL:$IMAGE_TAG
    - docker push $API_REPOSITORY_URL:$CI_ENVIRONMENT_NAME
    - docker build -t $WS_REPOSITORY_URL:$IMAGE_TAG -t $WS_REPOSITORY_URL:$CI_ENVIRONMENT_NAME -f docker/Dockerfile-websocket .
    - docker push $WS_REPOSITORY_URL:$IMAGE_TAG
    - docker push $WS_REPOSITORY_URL:$CI_ENVIRONMENT_NAME
  retry: 2
  only:

    - staging

deploy staging:

   -cd helm && helmfile sync

  only:

  tags:
    - teacherly-k8s

  script:

    - docker push $API_REPOSITORY_URL:$IMAGE_TAG

    - docker push $WS_REPOSITORY_URL:$IMAGE_TAG
    - docker push $WS_REPOSITORY_URL:$CI_ENVIRONMENT_NAME
  retry: 2

  only:

build dev images:

How I understood the process of configuring APM for our Laravel project so far:

# By the doc in the repo([https://github.com/philkra/elastic-apm-laravel|https://github.com/philkra/elastic-apm-laravel|smart-link] ) I will install and configure APM agent within the PHP project

Could you please clarify the second point and you might have feedback on my overall configuring process vision

* Synced with Gena, he explained that deployment on Elastic cloud is already created and we will specify [https://apm-344w.teacherly.io/|https://apm-344w.teacherly.io/] on staging
* Went throughout agent documentation and discussed needed variables
1. APM_ACTIVE - must include to env's
2. APM_APPNAME - hardcode it
3. APM_SERVERURL - must include to env's
4. APM_SECRETTOKEN - not needed
5. APM_USEROUTEURI - must include to env's(set True)

* Have been facing issue with being unable to install apm laravel agent due to dependency conflicts
* Solved issue by downloading xdebug-handler:1.4.2 first, then uuid:3.9.3 and only after elastic-apm-laravel: 5.6.0

Conclusion for today:

# Synced with Gena and clarified all questions upon configurations. At first, configuration is straightforward
# I was able to install only the oldest version of the needed package(elastic-apm-laravel). All of the newest versions were throwing dependency conflicts due to PHP version
# Configured and created an elastic deployment for test purposes and to better understand the overall process
# Configured needed variables fro agent and tested them by adding to .env file

What problems I am having right now:

Seems like limitation from library draft-js. It doesn't support true formatting of numbered and bulleted lists. I've looked at other js editor libraries on the net, some of them also have this issue.
Google slides works differently. Google has its own complex library which acts as a native text editor.
Canva uses quill.js which looks like it’s able to format well, but their website is down and I couldn’t see which limitation it has. Because we’re always looking at how we can improve text editor Quill.js might be not the solution we want. I see some developers who used Quill and Draft to Slate.js after struggling customizing it. In a future we might consider building oure feature rich wyswig editor

Teacher, in workspace he participate, can see all classes created by other members in this workspace.

About new organization owner logic (migration case)

* All existing Teacher Admins become Teachers in their organizations (they will synced with teacher role id if didn't have it on migration moment) + their id’s will save into organization’s owner_id field.
* Create new “technical user“ to become _lonely_ organizations owner. In that case we can delegate organization owner on demand, in the future.
* If some organization *haven't* Teacher Admin, that organization will be owned by created technical user.

[~accountid: 5b67bcd8e6dba529eefda937] [~accountid:557058:1ea93978-7189-478c-802a-3ba4422731a6] It seems that the main problem now is with elements that contain a link to the source. For example, by adding a picture to the phase, as a result, I get two http requests to load it (one for the thumbnail, the second for the phase). A simple solution might be to use lazy loading of content. This technique helps to load image content after the main page has loaded without blocking it. There is a native attribute for this {code:html}{code} More details about it: [https://habr.com/ru/company/ruvds/blog/448914/|https://habr.com/ru/company/ruvds/blog/448914/] But it has a minus, it is not supported in all browsers and works in chrome from version 75 [https://caniuse.com/#search=loading|https://caniuse.com/#search=loading] There are alternative ways to do the same using various js libraries. Here is more information about Lazy loading: * [https://www.sitepoint.com/five-techniques-lazy-load-images-website-performance/|https://www.sitepoint.com/five-techniques-lazy-load-images-website-performance /] * [https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/lazy-loading-guidance/images-and-video|https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/performance/lazy-loading- guidance/images-and-video] What do you say?

flow:

/teacher/retreat/redirect:

* if is logged in:
** check mail with your mail (the list will be provided by the business team, you will need to chordcode)
** if any, duplicate specific patterns for the user
** redirect his template page to /lesson-templates
*else:
** redirect to a new page /login





/teacher/retreat/login:

* check mail with your mail (the list will be provided by the business team, you will need to enter the code)
* check if there is a user object with such mail in the system:
** if any, duplicate specific patterns for the user
** redirect his template page to /lesson-templates
** if not present, display an error



/teacher/retreat/register:

* check mail with your mail (the list will be provided by the business team, you will need to enter the code)
* register the user in the system in the authority. Teacherly Ltd
* duplicate certain patterns for the user
* redirect his template page to /lesson-templates

h2. Backend problems & bugs:

h3. Timing - Per Question

# A very long delay to switch the question if the time is up. (When the student did not have time to answer the question and asks for the next one, the previous one is returned. The delay before switching the question (endpoint /questions) to the next one works very strange, sometimes you need to wait about a minute, and sometimes switching is instantaneous, on average it takes 15-30 seconds, you should try to reduce it to 5-10 seconds.
# When an incorrect answer is attempted and a retake is attempted, the question that was answered incorrectly is loaded with the old {{timerEnd}} and {{timerStart}} fields.
# Sometimes it happens that an empty question {{[]}} comes up instead of what is expected. If there are no more questions, then let an error come instead of an empty answer.

h4. Pattern: strangler fig application

The idea is that the old and the new can coexist, giving the new system time to grow and potentially entirely replace the old system.

When we implement this idea, we strive to not only take incremental steps towards our new application architecture, but also ensure that each step is easily reversible, reducing the risk of each incremental step.

h4. How it works

This may involve actually copying the code from the monolith (if possible), or else reimplementing the functionality in question. In addition, if the functionality in question requires the persistence of state, then consideration needs to be given to how that state can be migrated to the new service, and potentially back again.

Implementing a strangler fig pattern relies on three steps, as outlined in figure below. First, identify parts of the existing system that you wish to migrate. Then need to implement this functionality in new microservice. With new implementation ready, we need to be able to reroute calls from the monolith over to new microservice.

!image-20200513-101101.png|width=876,height=316!



!image-20200513-100703.png|width=585,height=256!

*Caution*

When migrating functionality, try to eliminate any changes in the behavior being moved—delay new features or bug fixes until the migration is complete if you can. Otherwise, you may reduce your ability to roll back changes to your system.

h4. Pattern overview for our case:

!http-stragler.jpg|width=874,height=1143!

Hello. Atifa haunts the question and video conferences on his EC2 and asks me:

# How much does AWS cost per user per month?
# What will the cost be for AWS for 10,000 active daily users who use the platform 1 hour a day?
# What will it cost for 100,000 teachers?
# What will the cost be for live lessons server per user who live streamed 5 lessons all 1 hour each though Aws?
No time to post answers? For video, let's take c5.xlarge with 1Gbits/s. Suppose each user will stream video 0.6 Mbits/s
The amount of traffic will be calculated according to the following formula:
Y = .6 Mbits/sec
W = number of cameras that are streaming
U = number of users watching
9:46
Incoming server traffic: W * Y
9:46
Outgoing traffic: W*(U-1)*Y
9:47
I take the BigBlueButton tool as an example [http://docs.bigbluebutton.org/support/faq.html#what-are-the-bandwidth-requirements-for-running-a-bigbluebutton-server.|http://docs. bigbluebutton.org/support/faq.html#what-are-the-bandwidth-requirements-for-running-a-bigbluebutton-server.]
We won't drink anything
[docs.bigbluebutton.orgdocs.bigbluebutton.org|http://docs.bigbluebutton.orgdocs.bigbluebutton.org]
BigBlueButton FAQ
Open Source Web Conferencing
9:48
He is very interested in how much money this will cost

*Calculation of server cost for video conferencing based on c5.xlarge BigBlueButton*

if it is on demand instance, then the server itself, regardless of how many people use it and whether they use it at all, will cost

c5.xlarge 4 20 8 GiB EBS only $0.202 per hour

0.202_24_30 = $145.46 per instance

a plus
Amazon Elastic Block Storage (EBS) pricing (monthly)
$3.48

total *150.94 USD*

$0.09 per GB for outbound traffic
All data transfer $0.00 per GB

Analysis of questions.

# The question is not entirely accurate, it depends on what this user will do, how many lessons and how many hours he will watch the video. Also, we do not have statistics on how many hours per day, on average, one user watches lessons.
# On this item, the amount is significant. Example
Let's say that according to the condition, one user watches 1 hour of video lessons per day. At the same time, it should be taken into account that if someone streams this lesson through the platform, then its traffic is not taken into account because, as I indicated above, the incoming traffic is free, and the lessons are streamed through the platform for the instance, this will be incoming traffic.
It turns out we consider only those who watch the video, i.e. outgoing traffic. According to the condition, the speed per user is 0.6 Mbps, while 1 user watches lessons for 1 hour a day, in total there are 10,000 of them:
0.6 Mbps = 0.075 Mbps
0.075 * 60 * 60 = 270 MB per hour
270 * 10000 = 2700000 MB
2700000 / 1000 = 2700 GB
2700 * 0.09 = $243 per day
Provided that there will be 10,000 users per day who watch video lessons for an hour
or
$0.0243 per user
\! This is not counting the cost of the instance itself, because the cost of an instance does not depend on the number of users. Another nuance is to check whether this server can withstand such a load.
# If teachers do not watch anything for them, it will not cost anything, it turns out that the costs go only to the end user because incoming traffic is free
# On the fourth point, not how much it will cost for the one who streamed depends on how many people watched. Only outgoing traffic is taken into account, it is paid

\!\!\! It should be noted that since there is no exact statistics, these data are approximate and may differ in practice

0.075 * 60 * 60 = 270 MB per hour

The list of accounts with incorrect classes & assignments assign logic, in total 149 students, all were created in 2015, 2016, 2017



[~accountid:5b67bcd8e6dba529eefda937] [~accountid:557058:1ea93978-7189-478c-802a-3ba4422731a6] 



SQL request

{noformat}select distinct ass.`user_id`, u.email, u.created_at, u.updated_at
from assignments_students_join as ass 
left join assignments on assignments.id=ass.`assignment_id`
left join users as u on ass.`user_id`=u.id
WHERE assignments.class_id not in 

(select distinct us.`class_id`
from users_classes_join as us
where us.user_id=ass.user_id){noformat}

Golang Client Library - [https://pkg.go.dev/google.golang.org/api/classroom/v1?tab=doc|https://pkg.go.dev/google.golang.org/api/classroom /v1?tab=doc]

I am curious on how to properly make authorized API requests to Google.

So they have {{option}} package which we can use to configure our client to authorize via Credentials [https://pkg.go.dev/google.golang.org/api/option?tab=doc#WithCredentials|https: //pkg.go.dev/google.golang.org/api/option?tab=doc#WithCredentials]

Credentials we will get from Auth Code from Teacherly Web Site request.

[~accountid:5cee2d23919eaf0f2135ac64] , correct me if I am wrong
We don't need actually Google SSO, we need to figure out how to sign-in through google account from GSuite.

Need to add G Suite domain entity to organization.

When we need to integrate [google sign-in|https://developers.google.com/identity/sign-in/web/backend-auth] for teachers ([https://slate.teacherly.io/teacher/login |https://slate.teacherly.io/teacher/login])

In sign-in process gets the user [hosted domain|https://developers.google.com/identity/sign-in/web/reference#googleusergethosteddomain] and if we have organization with such domain we auto add new teacher account with Name , Family Name and mail to it. In otherwise respond with meaningful error message.

Access to Classroom API enabled by default for all teachers.

[https://support.google.com/edu/classroom/answer/6250906|https://support.google.com/edu/classroom/answer/6250906]
Oauth2 scoops for Classrooms API

In existing backend we have to implement [Google Sign-In|https://developers.google.com/identity/#google-sign-in]. Basic profile information is not enough, so in {{scope}} parameter we need to specify desired scopes of Classroom API.

Google Classroom API has [list of scopes|https://developers.google.com/classroom/guides/auth] with different levels of usage, that can require extra verification process.

Need to figure out how to properly implement further requests to API from our service.

This [video|https://youtu.be/zZt8SFivjps] explains how authorization process works.

So we need to:

# Get permissions (scopes) on Teacherly web site and retrieve Auth Code from Google
# Send it to new service with a request to import classroom data
# In new service we have to exchange Auth Code to Credentials from Google
# Make API requests with these credentials.

Also Google recommends:

* to grant user with each scopes separately when these scopes are needed, not directly after authentication.
* to store credentials after each API request

On Teacherly web site side after authentication we have to validate Audience and Issuer parameters from obtained ID token.
After reading the documentation and testing classroom API we decide to not build our own import service. Better to use google classroom API directly with php-client.

# For students, I see Sign in with G Suite, but for students we added google sign-in without gsuite.
# In case when there is no student in an organization and I try to login using Google - I see “Account does not have G Suite”.
## Ex: I will see an error message like “Your account doesn’t register at Teacherly. Please contact your teacher"

Empty slide - features of drag-n-drop, but I think it's possible to solve

Before dragging the phase, you need to hold it down - this is a prerequisite, because otherwise dragging and scrolling on touch devices will not work. Events work like this: move your finger - scroll, hold it down for 150ms - the slide is taken and the movement starts. Both me and Naki looked ar [Socket.io|http://Socket.io] and Public Jitsi Meet solution to solve this issue. Neither of them doesn't allow us to kick users from a call whenever lead finishes it.

* [Socket.IO|http://Socket.IO] on disconnect doesn't know whether leader or guest disconnected. SocketIO doesn't provide this details
* Jitsi Meet API also doesnt whether leader or not hung up. It's no way to find out. But we understand that internally Jitsi whether it is a moderator or owner who left the call.

Using Public solution it's not possible to track teachers and students on video call. We need to customize our own Meet to do it

{quote}[@nakusyat|https://teacherlyio.slack.com/team/UCAUM32CW] [@Gulya|https://teacherlyio.slack.com/team/UHWRS1HNK] [@Ulan Kozhomuratov|https://teacherlyio. slack.com/team/UDN1TE4SW] [@Dmitri Kononenko|https://teacherlyio.slack.com/team/UR0DY812Q] turns out it's not possible to download files from web and upload them to S3 all by frontend itself due to CORS policies on websites from which we try to fetch images and files. Most sites have CORS configured and neither {{fetch}} nor {{axios}} or any other frontend tool is able to retrieve content from those websites. Even though {{fetch}} has {{mode: no-cors}} and is able to perform request its data is opaque and isn't readable. I guess we have to come up with a solution for image / file upload from backend{quote}

*Standard Status Evaluation Logic:*

if there are no students in standard lessons → *failed*

if there are no failed students in standard lessons → *passed*

if there are both passed and failed students, need to evaluate percentage by the formula:

100% - all students

x - passed students

so, (100*passed students) / All students

*Getty Images API*

Authentication - Requested API KEY

Authorization - Requested Access Token - [https://developers.gettyimages.com/en/authorization-faq.html#authorization-workflows|https://developers.gettyimages.com/en/authorization-faq.html#authorization-workflows ]

API provides swagger with endpoints - [https://api.gettyimages.com/swagger/index.html|https://api.gettyimages.com/swagger/index.html]

As I understand, Getty images platform not free, *need to buy a license to use images* (read it in FAQ [https://www.gettyimages.com/faq/basics#Using-images-for-free|https: //www.gettyimages.com/faq/basics#Using-images-for-free])

----



It is possible to get a list of pictures + you can get information about the picture by id

It is possible to search for images (you can filter by word, by page, by age, etc.)

The API provides a list of parameters

The only thing I didn’t find was how to get the API KEY, I registered, but they didn’t provide me with the key, and I didn’t receive any mail. I searched the site, didn’t find it, I think you need to get a license first or write to support.

The only thing you can get for free (as I understand it) is embed pictures

[https://www.gettyimages.com/resources/embed|https://www.gettyimages.com/resources/embed]

[https://developer.gettyimages.com/api/oembed/|https://developer.gettyimages.com/api/oembed/]

[~accountid:5b67bcd8e6dba529eefda937] about this bug, I checked code, the problem is actually in URL

URL contains the name of the subject of the class



f.e.: arabic-a is the subject name of the class with id 363

!image-20200302-091131.png|width=865,height=71!



The bug has appeared when there is no subject name (the problem is that when you navigate through the tabs, the front sends a request to get the class by id, the backend does not have time to give payload (pending), and the URL breaks, that is, the name of the subject did not have time to substitute because payload hasn't arrived yet)

!image-20200302-091255.png|width=901,height=217!



solution:



Communicated with Aleksei, Naki, and Vlad, one of the solutions is to remove that subject name of the class from URL.

It will look like _teacher/classes/363/assignments_ without subject title

# *> For this moment, I can opt-out of the quiz. Do we need to force Student to start quiz in the finish on the lesson?*

flow:

h2. *Resolution of sync with* [~accountid:557058:4d51e61f-f264-4dac-b7cd-d45ab512d07e]

----

We discussed the API logic for quizzes and came up with the following preliminary results:

We will have 3-4 endpoints for working with quizzes:

* Getting general quiz data - to get data and display the start/final page of the quiz.
* Get Question - to get the next available question. The very first question will be given without an answer.
* Answer to the question
* Completion of the quiz

Ulan is currently working on the API architecture for quizzes. After the end, we will meet again for a synch to once again discuss everything and start developing.

----

Communicated with Ulan about `quizzes` API logic and found the following:

We'll have 3-4 API endpoints for {{quizzes}}:

* Get quiz data - for getting basic data of quiz and displaying start/finish quiz page.
* Get next question - for getting next available question. The first question without an answer will be returned.
*Answer to question
* Finish quiz

At the moment Ulan works with API architecture for {{quizzes}}

h2. Quiz questions:

# How and when to change the color of the number of answers/questions on the finish page project/5d9c6eba650cc91f7c7595aa/screen/5d9c6f316b4ca76bed6af307])
# Currently one question cannot have multiple answers on the back, but can on the front. What implementation needs to be done?

[https://app.zeplin.io/project/5d9c6eba650cc91f7c7595aa/screen/5d9c6f3014978e06ac8fcb75|https://app.zeplin.io/project/5d9c6eba650cc91f7c7595aa/screen/5d9c6f3014978e06ac8fcb75]
# What should happen when a student passed a quiz and the teacher changed it (deleted/added questions)?

h2. Answers:

# If the quiz is not passed - red color, if the quiz is passed, but there are errors - yellow color.
# Need to back up the front and only allow one correct answer to be sent
# You need to remove the restriction on the back. On the front, you need to implement textarea instead of input
# You need to allow the transition to the quiz only when the status is in_progress. If the status is \!== in_progress - display the tooltip on click. Also in the quiz, you also need to check the status of the lesson and do a redirect + notification

# When a student has not started a lesson, we do not give him the opportunity to open a quiz
# If the teacher has changed the status to finished - the student cannot do anything
# Need to display an alert if a student hasn't passed all quizzes

# If there are lessons in the class with only one subject, then we change the class icon to the icon of the subject from these lessons
# If lessons in the class have different subjects, then we change the class icon to the multi-subject icon (it is drawn by Vlada)

# All teacher entries associated with the step being removed must also be removed. You also need to delete files from S3 if they were uploaded there. In the deletion confirmation popup, you may need to add a notification about the deletion of all files associated with this step.
# If the document is uploaded by HR, then its status should automatically become {{APPROVED}}.
# Yes, HR can delete the {{APPROVED}} file at any time.

Teacher flow answers:

* The teacher can only upload a file, and also download an already uploaded file
* If the document status is {{APPROVED}} or {{WAITING}}, then the teacher can only download the file
* If the status is {{REJECTED}} - the teacher can view the uploaded file, as well as upload a new one
* If the teacher does not have {{record}}'a(uploaded file), then he can only upload the file

Problem: If the user opens a section without lessons or templates, the page reads “No lessons”. However, there is an improved message for such cases developed by the designers.

If the visitor of teacherly enters the page when there are problems in the server or with the wrong URL, the page shows the default mistake message from the browser. Vlad introduced the custom-designed image for such mistakes (????Vlad, please share the link).

Purpose: To change the current pic “No lessons” “404 no page found” “The 500 Internal Server Error” to the messages designed by Vlad.

In the Classes and Templates (including internal sections):

When a teacher opens a section (Lessons, Templates) that does not have the template or lessons, the teachers sees the custom-designed image for such mistakes;

When a teacher opens any page of teachery.io with mistakes, the page shows the custom-designed image.

The contract only loads HR

General fields for all optional

General - write in which fields how much can be loaded.

* Passport - as many as you like
* Qualifications - one file, one link
* References - as many links as you want
* We support all file types that are available in our system
* Validation of the size of the uploaded photo on HR
*Click on photo to open in new window
* Contract - one file
If the HR document is uploaded, it will be automatically approved.
When deleting a step in the wizard, a standard pop-up confirmation.
All documents with the Approved status are filled out, a new item is added by HR - the teacher will receive the Onboarding status.
The teacher cannot delete the uploaded document, only download it. We can re-upload (in the Reject status if the document).

Alerts for teachers

# HR made a change in the wizard: added a new step, changed the form. (Teacher in Onboarding status and document in empty step status - need to upload a new document)

Notification text: <Teacher> made a change to the file (link to the teacher's profile and automatically scroll the page)

When you click on a notification, it becomes read

Clear all - clear notifications.

The number on the bell is the number of unread notifications.
For now, link onboard steps to one HR. Only one user with the HR role is created for each organization.

Call results:

* The steps in the General tab are still hardcoded, because they are already laid out according to the current logic. In the future, after receiving feedback, changes are possible.
* If two documents are loaded in a step and one of them turned out to be invalid as a result of the check, then two files are reloaded.
* Tie onboard steps to one HR for now. Only one user with the HR role is created for each organization.

After calling Vlad and Roma about the documents uploaded by the teacher, they came to the conclusion that it would be faster and easier to accept the formula one step = one document. We decided to ask Atif whether it is critical to be able to attach more than one document to one step.

Today on the call ([~accountid:5daf4d1679a9390c30c734e6] [~accountid:557058:7ae9d263-27ab-437c-9306-d8fad371f87c] @atif [~accountid:5b67bcd8e6dba529eefda937] ) we discussed 1 document steping = 1 document in onboarding.

We decided to do 1 step = 1 document. We leave more than 1 document in a step to one of the following iterations.

New questions about “Onboarding-documents” form:

# What need to do with {{records}} when HR delete {{onboarding-step}}?
# Which status should the document have when HR uploaded it?

Answers for questions about "onboarding-documents":

# All teacher's records attached to removable step should be deleted. Also need to delete documents from S3. In “Remove confirmation” popup need to update text and notify HR that all teacher’s documents, attached to step, will be delete.
# If the document uploaded by HR, it's status should be automatically {{APPROVED}}
# Yes, HR can delete document with status {{APPROVED}} at any time

Teacher app “onboarding-documents” flow:

* The teacher can only upload the document, or can download already uploaded document
* If document status is {{APPROVED}} or {{WAITING_FOR_APPROVAL}}, the teacher can only download the document
* If document status is {{REJECTED}}, the teacher can see downloaded document, or car upload new document
* If the teacher hasn't {{record}}(uploaded file), the teacher can only upload new document

created instance
install docker runner gitlab

{code:java}
yum update -y
amazon-linux-extras install docker
service docker start
yum install -y aws-cli

curl -L https://github.com/docker/compose/releases/download/1.24.1/docker-compose-`uname -s`-`uname -m` > /bin/docker-compose
chmod +x /bin/docker-compose
chown root:docker /bin/docker-compose


sudo usermod -aG ec2-user docker
sudo mkdir -p /opt/docker/gitlab-runner/

docker rm -f gitlab-runner || true


docker run --rm -v /opt/docker/gitlab-runner/config:/etc/gitlab-runner -v /usr/bin/docker:/usr/bin/docker --name gitlab-runner gitlab/gitlab-runner register \
--non-interactive \
--executor "docker" \
--docker-image docker:dind \
--url "https://gitlab.com/" \
--registration-token "Pq3zCWtshensgscbMWau" \
--description "teacherly-digital-passport" \
--tag-list "digital-passport" \
--run-untagged \
--locked="false"

docker rm -f gitlab-runner || true
docker run -d --restart always -v /opt/docker/gitlab-runner/config:/etc/gitlab-runner -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -v /usr /bin/docker:/usr/bin/docker --name gitlab-runner gitlab/gitlab-runner:latest

{code}

How should this block work?

----

At the end of the lesson, the student evaluates:

# Standards
# Master skills (the teacher can start - how to work with them?)
# MYP are there outcams?

----

If 6 students out of 20 did not understand the standard, then output in kurglyash how many students failed and color in color - [https://s.mail.ru/H35B/Bim494Uet|https://s.mail.ru/H35B/Bim494Uet] , Painting logic - [https://s.mail.ru/DcoH/yUZv68eoe|https://s.mail.ru/DcoH/yUZv68eoe]

The teacher in the digital passport should have a block with a lesson as a link.

----

Block with three dots do but hide

----

2 statuses: Passed and Failed. Failed - if at least one lesson has at least 1 student who did not understand the material.

More than 80% - passed

Less than 40% - failed

*About the filter to clarify what the logic should be.* It is not completely clear.

----

For a student, all fields are required, everything except comments

----

Blockers: the teacher has a digital passport (there is no backend, the front is most likely only layout), the teacher does not have a certificate upload.

# If the student closed the browser, he can leave a feedback. The student's lesson is incomplete. If it leaves feedback and the lesson is over. Shows a popup with a link to the lesson
# Lesson icon without feedback
# Outcam display logic (lesson color mark) in the lesson, we display the feedback of those who left this feedback on the lesson.
# Show lessons by year
# The resulting color mark is calculated for the current academic year (September-July)
# We show the lesson right away (not only in the Finished status)
# Retake lesson - the teacher clicks on the lesson where the students did not understand, the lesson assignment modal opens for him (automatically select students who did not understand the lesson), then
# Show the block with the lesson with evaluation if the lesson has feedback
# Entity sub-lesson to correct grades when reassigning a lesson
# In the first iteration, clicking on a lesson opens the lesson in preview mode
# Quiz retake in the quiz options to enable the toggle switch whether it is possible to retake or not (does not go into this iteration)

Basic quizzes logic for students developed in [https://lumicislate.atlassian.net/browse/TILT-4275|https://lumicislate.atlassian.net/browse/TILT-4275|smart-link]

*image-marat2501/docker-compose:1.22*

hub where the official image with docker-compose is located
[https://hub.docker.com/r/docker/compose/|https://hub.docker.com/r/docker/compose/]



Dockerfile for marat2501/docker-compose:1.22
FROM docker/compose:1.22.0
RUN apk update && apk add --no-cache openssh



the difference between marat2501/docker-compose:1.22 and the official docker/compose:1.22.0 image with the docker-compose utility is the installation of an ssh client so that you can connect from the same image to the server

in tickerly, this test step does not use ssh connection for test steps. for tickerly, you can use the official docker/compose:1.22.0 image and nothing will break (like)

Why didn’t they immediately indicate the official image? because the pipelines copy-pasted from one project to another

*Communicated with admins and made research on custom images:*

{{marat2501/docker-compose:1.22}} - used in gitlab-ci.yaml for tests, in our case it is a backend test run in the pipeline. The difference between the image and the official one is that it has an ssh client

{{halfb00t/alpine:3.7}} - used for staging deployment

{{dartblack/ecs-deploy-migration}} - used for deployment to production

{{dymokd/apache-php7:latest}} - used to bring up the server where the code is running

*Docker-composes and Images description:*



{{docker-compose.yaml}} - used to raise the project on the local environment

{{docker-compose-backend-test.yml}} - used to raise and run backend tests

{{docker-compose-prod.yml}} - used to raise the project on a test environment

{{docker-compose-test.yml}} - used to raise and run frontend tests

{{docker-compose.yml.example}} - used as an example file

Production environment does not use docker-compose, does not use nginx

AWS cluster is used, there are servers for api, frontend, websocket. The database is on the RDS server.

Marat and Belek provided info about their custom images , here - [https://lumicislate.atlassian.net/browse/TILT-3444|https://lumicislate.atlassian.net/browse/TILT-3444|smart-link]

In the process found out one more custom image, created task for Dima - [https://lumicislate.atlassian.net/browse/TILT-3450|https://lumicislate.atlassian.net/browse/TILT-3450|smart- link]

need to take dockerfiles for {{halfb00t/alpine:3.7}}, {{dymokd/apache-php7:latest}} images

[@Dmitri Kononenko|https://teacherlyio.slack.com/team/UR0DY812Q] There was a problem checking the fonts on the “My Profile” page. Researched Lesson Preview design and component.

*What I learned:*

* Logic of Lesson Preview(phase switcher, fullscreen)

* Compared design for Teacher and Student.

Now i can't work with the task because i have questions about “Lesson Preview” flow. *Questions:*

* Can a student use fullscreen and how to do it? (There is no fullscreen button on design layout)
* “Begin Lesson“ button starts a lesson. Where this link/button will redirect to and how it will work?

*Answers to my questions:*

* When student click to “Begin lesson” we need to send request for change lesson status(to in progress) and show fullscreen for user.
* If status of lesson isn't “in progress” we need to hide controls.
* If status of lesson is “in progress” we need to change text on button “Begin lesson” to “Continue lesson” and we need to show controls(also in fullscreen mode and in normal mode)
After bugs fixing, I'll continue to work for this task
Planned to discuss it with Belek at 4 pm.

And here are the steps on how I start containers:
It is necessary to deploy two containers * on staging (the first nginx, the second nodejs server).
How do I Build and Run Containers

# All changes are in the {{digital-passport}} folder. It is necessary to build and collect only in this branch
# First we build and run a container with a nodejs service. It serves us like Fake API:

* $ cd fake-api
* $ docker build -t dashboard-fake-api .
* $ docker run --rm -p 3070:3000 dashboard-fake-api
By default, port 3000 is exposed, 3070 was opened for the world (it will be needed for the container with nginx)

# Build and run the container with nginx

* $ cd resources/assets/hr-dashboard
* docker build --build-arg REACT_APP_BASE_API_URL=[http://localhost:3070|http://localhost:3070] -t hr-dashboard .
* docker run --rm p 8080:80 hr-dashboard
The site is available at {{<http://localhost:8080/}}>
In the nginx (hr-dashboard) container, the REACT_APP_BASE_API_URL variable must refer to the nodejs (dashboard-fake-api) container (edited)

To create a database dump using a script, the following is required:
1. *You must have access to the staging server via SSH.*
2. *Download the script attached to the ticket and execute it*.

We can request all icons, we can request one icon, you can only sort by category and view full information, the same for packages. You need a premium account, otherwise update apiKey every hour

dock [https://developer.flaticon.com/documentation/index.html|https://developer.flaticon.com/documentation/index.html]

 You can try to change the color technically, since the colors come in HEX, it will not be difficult to identify them, but you need to look for the implementation

you can change the color of monochromatic ones in general like this

 {{const doc = parser.parseFromString(svg, "image/svg+xml");doc.documentElement.getElementsByTagName('path')\[0].style.fill = 'red';const elem = new XMLSerializer() .serializeToString(doc)console.log(elem)return <div dangerouslySetInnerHTML=\{\{ __html: elem}}/>;}}

Several colors can also be changed, but a little tedious

{{getElementsByTagName('path')}} returns multiple elements if the svg is complex and each path has its own fill that we can act on and edit

For understanding, the number of elements

!Screenshot 2019-10-23 at 23.42.51.png|width=1172,height=619!

All icons can be obtained by {{GET /items/icons/\{orderBy}}}

there are optional fields *page* and *limit*

[https://api.flaticon.com/v2/search/icons?categoryId=7|https://api.flaticon.com/v2/search/icons?categoryId=7]

can be sorted by category

{{GET /categories}} requests all categories, the response contains the name, description and a sprite which is a category preview of different sizes ([https://image.flaticon.com/sprites/share/categories/arrows.png|https: //image.flaticon.com/sprites/share/categories/arrows.png])

you can also search for packs and do all the same things as with categories (packs is a set of icons in the same style for example for social networks).

Need to create factory for {{GeneralDocument}} model. This model have {{mediumtext}} fields that are expected to contain json objects. So factory should be hardcoded to have values ​​that are expected in {{GeneralDocument}} model methods.

- The solution above was throwing error

{code:java}
Invalid argument supplied for foreach() in /var/www/app/Models/GeneralDocument.php:70
{code}
- It was because json string was saved incorrectly
- Investigated how data is being saved in controller store method.
- Found put that issue is in extra quotes and that I need to create array in array structure
- Investigated how to remove extra quotes on json_encode usage. Even trim did not help
- Finally solved problem by just not using json_encode. Faker was saving instance correctly(without errors)

path:

{code}POST api/admin/organisations{code}

params:

* *'name'* = 'string|required|min:1|max:256',
* *'address'* = 'string',
* *'phone'* = 'string',
* *'firstname'* = 'string',
* *'lastname'* = 'string',
* *'email'* = 'email|unique:users,email|required',
* *'password'* = 'string|confirmed|required',
* *'password_confirmation'* = 'string|required',

The next route returns the list of all organizations with the addresses and teacher admins

{code}GET api/admin/organizations{code}



Params for the pagination is:

*limit(default=20)
*offset
* orderby - sort by field
* direction - ASC, DESC

I have a question about registered users. Do we consider registered users as those who have registered on the page [https://teacherly.io/signup|https://teacherly.io/signup] or all users who have themselves registered and have registered teacher-admin accounts?

----

We can track login users (and registered users, which register on [https://teacherly.io/signup|https://teacherly.io/signup] page) with Google Analyticscs. To do it, we should set the targets by pressing the buttons.

Pros:

# GA already integrated

Cons:

# Third-party system
# We can't track logged in users (yesterday teacher filled out the form and authorized today and today he just opened the site and was already authorized).

----

Dashboard in the super-admin panel with daily notifications in slack (or email). Or count in the backend login and send daily-report in slack (or e-mail).

Pros:

# Notifications
# Familiar interface
# Ability to build data analysis with charts

Cons:

# Need to develop frontend and backend parts for the tool;

For example [https://forums.phpfreaks.com/topic/130624-solved-php-session-or-mysql-users-online-count-and-users-viewing-page-list/|https://forums. phpfreaks.com/topic/130624-solved-php-session-or-mysql-users-online-count-and-users-viewing-page-list/]

[https://www.sitepoint.com/real-time-apps-laravel-5-1-event-broadcasting/|https://www.sitepoint.com/real-time-apps-laravel-5-1- event-broadcasting/]

----

ELK stack to parse access logs and build graphs in Kibana.

[https://www.elastic.co/what-is/elk-stack|https://www.elastic.co/what-is/elk-stack]

Pros:

# Ready stack to be installed and set up

Cons:

# Additional infrastructure to be maintained.

I explored the possibility of using php-fpm as server backends for php.
The problem is php-fpm processes only php files, for distributing statics you will have to run the nginx container and forward the volume, or copy the statics to the nginx container.

We decided to make a choice on apache.
The new version of debian: buster cannot be used, since it does not have php7.0 support
I took the php: 7.0-apache-stretch image as a basis, assembled the container launched, there was a problem, links are not available. I need to figure this out.

Two new variables are added, they need to be copied to the .env file
APACHE_SERVERADMIN=mail@mail
APACHE_SERVERNAME=[local.slate.lumici.co.uk|http://local.slate.lumici.co.uk]

To start the project, you need to rebuild the api container

docker-compose down --remove-orphans
docker-compose up -d --build

remove env variable
APACHE SERVERADMIN=mail@mail
APACHE SERVER NAME=[local.slate.lumici.co.uk|http://local.slate.lumici.co.uk/]

[~accountid:557058:1ea93978-7189-478c-802a-3ba4422731a6] you need to create a video recording API that will allow you to record video. Paid options are also suitable

I looked at several options and the Youtube Streaming API seemed to be the most adequate.

* Zoom is more for conferences, but their api is not very documented either. I didn't find a way to download the stream to mp4
* Google Hangouts hasn't provided a video API for a long time. just for writing a chatbot. Apparently after the advent of Google Meets. And for the latter, you need an account connected to Meets
* Vimeo is not a bad option, but given the requirements and widely used Youtube API is better. (You can stream, save videos, and embedding videos in teacherly is also easy and there are examples)
