Update gitlab-ci.yml, change step for build and deploy to staging, expect branch master and production

{code}# Build image for staging from any branch, expect master and production
build_staging_any_branch:
  stage: build_staging
  script:
    - $(aws ecr get-login --no-include-email --region us-east-1)
    - docker build -t $API_REPOSITORY_URL $NEW_STAGING_BUILD_ARGS_API -f docker/Dockerfile-api-prod .
    - docker push $API_REPOSITORY_URL
    - docker build -t $WS_REPOSITORY_URL -f docker/Dockerfile-websocket .
    - docker push $WS_REPOSITORY_URL
  except:
    refs:
      - master
      - production
  when: manual
  allow_failure: false
  tags:
    - docker-runner

# Deploy to staging from any branch, expect master and production
deploy_staging_any_branch:
  stage: deploy_staging
  image: halfb00t/alpine:3.7
  except:
    refs:
      - master
      - production
  before_script:
    - eval "$(ssh-agent -s)"
    - echo "$STAGING_PRIVATE_KEY" | tr -d '\r' | ssh-add -> /dev/null
    - mkdir -p ~/.ssh
    - chmod 700 ~/.ssh
    - '[[ -f /.dockerenv ]] && echo -e "Host *\n\tStrictHostKeyChecking no\n\n" > ~/.ssh/config'
  script:
    - ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no ec2-user@$STAGING_ADDRESS "$DEPLOY_COMMAND"
    - ssh-agent -k
  tags:
    - docker-runner
{code}


and update step for run test



{code}# Run tests from any branch, expect master and production
run_tests_any_branch:
  stage: run_tests
  image:marat2501/docker-compose:1.22
  script:
    - apk add --no-cache curl git jq python py-pip
    pip install awscli
    - $(aws ecr get-login --no-include-email --region us-east-1)
    - docker build -t $API_REPOSITORY_URL:test --build-arg WS_URL=ws://websocket:3333 -f docker/Dockerfile-api-prod .
    - docker-compose -f docker-compose-test.yml up -d api
    - sleep 30
    - docker-compose -f docker-compose-test.yml run --no-deps --rm api php artisan migrate --force
    - docker-compose -f docker-compose-test.yml run cypress
  except:
    refs:
      - master
      - production
  artifacts:
    when: always
    paths:
    -cypress/screenshots
    -cypress/videos
    reports:
      junit: cypress/results/*.xml
  when: manual
  allow_failure: true
  tags:
    - docker-runner{code}

Questions:
1) Will standards work by country? or users(teachers) can see the entire list of standards in the system?
2) Will there be a binding of standards to organizations?
3) Who will have permissions to create, edit, delete the standard category (global standard) https://gyazo.com/2d4cf14f41fc474e18afbff9289d48f9 ?
4) Who will have permissions to create, edit, delete the group of standards https://gyazo.com/7cf2c30a3e19b59a474c0c8d29dac56d ?
5) Who will have permissions to create, edit, delete the standards itself https://gyazo.com/f435602efe23778411a9ea4f2896f024 ?
6) Can the group of standards belong to several standard categories?
7) Can the standard itself belong to several groups

Atif had answered the questions:
1. They will work by teachers. The teachers need to complete their profile and in the profile they will put in country and curriculum they teach. They will not see the entire list, only the curriculum standards they teach.
2. Standards do not need to be bound to organization because individual teachers can signup use the platform also. Binding the standards might add another layer of complexity.
3, 4 and 5 No one can edit the standards that are already in the system, you can add your own standards as a teacher and only you as a teacher will see those standards. You can then edit and remove only those standards. Not the global standards.
6 and 7 This can happen, yes.

*Summary of responses*
1) There will be the binding between standard and teacher , user_id with teacher type can be emply (null) . Global standard will not be bound with teachers
2) There will be the binding between standard and lesson , lesson_id can not be null
3) Based on the answer will be binding between country and standard
4) Based on the answer will be binding between curriculum and standards . which data will have curricum not clear yet


*After receiving the answers, there were more questions*
1) Standard code will be written by user or generated by the system?

2) Standards needs to be bound to the country , what data should be stored for the country in db? Will contry be bind with another models ?

3) Standards needs to be bound to curriculum , what structure(data) have curriculum ?

4) No one can edit the standards that are already in the system - who will upload that standards from the begining ? I guess that we will have functional for upload file with standards , maybe it will be excel file.

5) Can there be a group of standards without standard category linking ?

6) Can there be standard itself without group of standards linking?

7) Clarify the work of the Subject and Grades filters. Do they need.

write readme about deploy and run migration on ecs cluster
{code:java}
## Deploy to ECS cluster

For deployment and migrations, a docker image with 3 scripts was created
[First script](https://github.com/fabfuel/ecs-deploy) - created a new revision for task-definition and restarted the service with a new revision
When launching the script, you can specify a new tag of the docker image or not specify and use the latest.

[The second script](https://github.com/dalen/ecs-run) is used to start a one-time task based on an already running but with another command. in our case, the migration command. `php artisan migrate --force`

[The third script](https://aws.amazon.com/cli/?nc1=h_ls)- program The AWS Command Line Interface (CLI) is a unified tool to manage your AWS services. With just one tool to download and configure, you can control multiple AWS services from the command line and automate them through scripts.

```
FROM rust:1.27.2 as builder

COPY deploy-aws/ .

RUN cargo install --root /usr/local

FROM debian:stretch-slim as runner

RUN apt-get update && \
  DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get install -y ca-certificates curl git jq python-pip && \
  apt-get clean && \
  rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/* && \
  pip --no-cache-dir install awscli ecs-deploy

COPY --from=builder /usr/local/bin/ecs-run /usr/local/bin/ecs-run
```

Docker image called `image: dartblack/ecs-deploy-migration` publicly available for use.
to use it, you need to pass 3 environment variables for authorization in AWS
```
AWS_DEFAULT_REGION
AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
```

### Use docker image in gitlab-ci

```
deploy_to_aws:
  stage: deploy_to_aws
  image: dartblack/ecs-deploy-migration
  when: manual
  only:
    - production
  before_script:
    -AWS_DEFAULT_REGION=eu-west-2
    - CLUSTER_ARN=`aws ecs list-clusters --output text --region "${AWS_DEFAULT_REGION}" --query clusterArns`
    - SERVICE_ARN_WS=`aws ecs list-services --cluster $CLUSTER_ARN --region "${AWS_DEFAULT_REGION}" --output text --query serviceArns --page-size 1 | grep ws-`
    - SERVICE_ARN_API=`aws ecs list-services --cluster "$CLUSTER_ARN" --region "${AWS_DEFAULT_REGION}" --output text --query serviceArns --page-size 1 | grep api-`
  script:
    - ecs deploy $CLUSTER_ARN $SERVICE_ARN_WS --timeout 500
    - ecs deploy $CLUSTER_ARN $SERVICE_ARN_API --timeout 500
    - ecs-run $CLUSTER_ARN $SERVICE_ARN_API php artisan migrate --force
```

before_script:
   - `AWS_DEFAULT_REGION=eu-west-2` - reassign region
   - `CLUSTER_ARN` - learn and assign ARN cluster
   - `SERVICE_ARN_WS` - learn and assign ARN service WebSocket
   - `SERVICE_ARN_API` - learn and assign ARN service API
script:
   - `ecs deploy $CLUSTER_ARN $SERVICE_ARN_WS --timeout 500` - created a new revision for task-definition and restarted the service with a new revision for API and WebSocket
   - `ecs-run $CLUSTER_ARN $SERVICE_ARN_API php artisan migrate --force` - run migration
{code}

{code:java}
deploy_to_aws:

    -AWS_DEFAULT_REGION=eu-west-2
    - CLUSTER_ARN=`aws ecs list-clusters --output text --region "${AWS_DEFAULT_REGION}" --query clusterArns`
    - SERVICE_ARN_WS=`aws ecs list-services --cluster $CLUSTER_ARN --region "${AWS_DEFAULT_REGION}" --output text --query serviceArns --page-size 1 | grep ws-`
    - SERVICE_ARN_API=`aws ecs list-services --cluster "$CLUSTER_ARN" --region "${AWS_DEFAULT_REGION}" --output text --query serviceArns --page-size 1 | grep api-`

    - echo "RUN MIGRATION"
    - ecs-run $CLUSTER_ARN $SERVICE_ARN_API php artisan migrate --force
    - echo "DONE MIGRATION"
  tags:
    - docker-runner

final version
Tested on the gitlab-runner
{code:java}
deploy_to_aws:
  stage: deploy_to_aws
  image: dartblack/ecs-deploy-migration
  when: manual
  only:
    - production
  before_script:
    -AWS_DEFAULT_REGION=eu-west-2
    - CLUSTER_ARN=`aws ecs list-clusters --output text --region "${AWS_DEFAULT_REGION}" --query clusterArns`
    - SERVICE_ARN_WS=`aws ecs list-services --cluster $CLUSTER_ARN --region "${AWS_DEFAULT_REGION}" --output text --query serviceArns --page-size 1 | grep ws-`
    - SERVICE_ARN_API=`aws ecs list-services --cluster "$CLUSTER_ARN" --region "${AWS_DEFAULT_REGION}" --output text --query serviceArns --page-size 1 | grep api-`
  script:
    - ecs deploy $CLUSTER_ARN $SERVICE_ARN_WS --timeout 500
    - ecs deploy $CLUSTER_ARN $SERVICE_ARN_API --timeout 500
    - ecs-run $CLUSTER_ARN $SERVICE_ARN_API php artisan migrate --force
  tags:
    - docker-runner
{code}

Added relation to notification with LessonTemplates. Now notification payload contains "lesson" and "lesson_templates". "lesson" array for the shared/collaborate lessons and "lesson_template" for shared/collaborate templates.

When the teacher creates a new class there are no relations between users and assignments with this class except one, teacher and created class. This relation is reflected in "users_classes_join" table. Later the teacher can invite more students to the class. Users accepted invites will be added to the "users_classes_join" table.

Until today, when the teacher duplicates lessons from unsorted lessons or other classes to the newly created class the script assigns all students in this class to the duplicated lesson and set default state "Upcoming". Now duplicated lessons have not assignments with students and default status is "Draft".

{code:java}
FROM halfb00t/php:7.0-cli-stretch

RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y gcc g++ make gnupg gnupg2 gnupg1 apt-transport-https xvfb libgtk2.0-0 libnotify-dev libgconf-2-4 libnss3 libxss1 libasound2

RUN curl -s https://deb.nodesource.com/gpgkey/nodesource.gpg.key | apt-key add - && \
echo 'deb https://deb.nodesource.com/node_8.x stretch main' > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list && \
echo 'deb-src https://deb.nodesource.com/node_8.x stretch main' >> /etc/apt/sources.list.d/nodesource.list && \
apt-get update && apt-get install -y nodejs

RUN curl -sL https://dl.yarnpkg.com/debian/pubkey.gpg | apt-key add - && \
echo "deb https://dl.yarnpkg.com/debian/ stable main" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/yarn.list && \
apt-get update && apt-get -y install yarn
RUN npm i cypress
RUN npm install -g gulp-cli

ENV NODEUNBUFFERED 1

ARG WS_URL=wss://ws.staging.teacherly.io:443
ENV WS_URL ${WS_URL}


ARG APP_KEY=<app_key_here>
ENV APP_KEY${APP_KEY}
COPY. .

RUN export DB_HOST=localhost \
    && export DB_DATABASE=test \
    && export DB_USERNAME=test \
    && export DB_PASSWORD=test \
    && composer install --no-interaction

EXPOSE 80
CMD ["php", "artisan", "serve", "--host", "0.0.0.0", "--port", "80"]

{code:java}
run_tests:
  stage: run_tests
  image:marat2501/docker-compose:1.22
  script:
    - apk add --no-cache curl git jq python py-pip
    pip install awscli
    - $(aws ecr get-login --no-include-email --region us-east-1)
    - docker build -t $API_REPOSITORY_URL:test --build-arg WS_URL=ws://websocket:3333 -f docker/Dockerfile-api-prod .
    - docker-compose -f docker-compose-test.yml up -d api
    - sleep 20
    - docker-compose -f docker-compose-test.yml run --no-deps --rm api php artisan migrate --force
    - docker-compose -f docker-compose-test.yml run cypress
  only:
    - develop
  artifacts:
    when: always
    paths:
    -cypress/screenshots
    -cypress/videos
    reports:
      junit: cypress/results.xml
  when: manual
  allow_failure: true
  tags:
    - docker-runner
{code}

Now if there is a push to the branch production
you can run the build for pre-production
If the build is successful, then it will pass on to the pre-production

add branch production in gitlab
add stages for build and deploy
{no format}
stages:
.....
  - build_pre_prod
  - deploy_pre_prod
....


build_pre_prod:
  stage: build_pre_prod
  script:
    - $(aws ecr get-login --no-include-email --region us-east-1)
    - docker build -t $API_REPOSITORY_URL:beta --build-arg WS_URL=$PRE_PROD_WS_URL -f docker/Dockerfile-api-prod .
    - docker push $API_REPOSITORY_URL:beta
    - docker build -t $WS_REPOSITORY_URL:beta -f docker/Dockerfile-websocket .
    - docker push $WS_REPOSITORY_URL:beta
  only:
    - production
  when: manual
  allow_failure: false
  tags:
    - docker-runner

deploy_pre_prod:
  stage: deploy_pre_prod
  image: halfb00t/alpine:3.7
  only:
    - production
  before_script:
    - eval "$(ssh-agent -s)"
    - echo "$PRE_PROD_PRIVATE_KEY" | tr -d '\r' | ssh-add -> /dev/null
    - mkdir -p ~/.ssh
    - chmod 700 ~/.ssh
    - '[[ -f /.dockerenv ]] && echo -e "Host *\n\tStrictHostKeyChecking no\n\n" > ~/.ssh/config'
  script:
    - ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no ec2-user@$PRE_PROD_ADDRESS "$PRE_PROD_DEPLOY_COMMAND"
    - ssh-agent -k
  tags:
    - docker-runner

{no format}

add env

{no format}
PRE_PROD_ADDRESS=slate.teacherly.io #address for deploy pre prod
PRE_PROD_DEPLOY_COMMAND=cd /opt/teacherly && eval `aws ecr get-login --no-include-email --region us-east-1` && docker-compose pull && docker-compose up -d && docker-compose run -- rm api php artisan migrate --force && docker-compose ps && docker image prune -f # command for deploy pre prod
PRE_PROD_PRIVATE_KEY=<ssh private key> springloops-slate-pre-production.pem # ssh key for autorization pre prod
PRE_PROD_SSH_KNOWN_HOSTS=<fingerprintkey> # ssh-keyscan slate.teacherly.io
PRE_PROD_WS_URL=ws.slate.teacherly.io # web socket url for build docker image for pre prod
{no format}

Phoned [~accountid:557058:4d51e61f-f264-4dac-b7cd-d45ab512d07e]. Topics discussed:

# Subscription management (limits per subscription plan and price per plan)
# Trial period
# Auto payments by subscription
# Unsubscribe
# Invoice history in profile

[~accountid:557058:4d51e61f-f264-4dac-b7cd-d45ab512d07e] will accumulate questions and post comments to the epic. Tolika addresses the question on the stripe.

We discussed a possible upgrade to Laravel 7.0, because there are a lot more features in the cashier library than in 5.5.

If there is a "Functional sale of small features for individual teachers", then in addition to subscriptions, you need to give the opportunity to make one-time payments in the system. What is meant by "small features"?

If an organization issues an Enterprise plan, will existing and future teachers have access to all the features?

If a teacher, having registered himself, chooses the Enterprise plan, then what are the actions of the system? He is sent a letter with information on what to do next and a link to HR and Teacher-Admin dashboards?

The trial period means the removal of restrictions on all features. How long does it last and what happens after it expires?

While the user is in the trial period, is it necessary to send notifications by mail and notifications in the system and with what frequency?

How should the "Subscription Manager" work? Will this be added to the super admin dashboard?

Does the internal marketplace mean that teachers can sell their content? How will they price the content?

While there are difficulties in understanding how to issue subscriptions of the Enterprise type. SHE is an organization or user.

*Nicolas Sklyaroff* 14 hours ago
Well, for starters, I found out how the subscription in the stripe works. it is created once in the stripe dashboard with price, duration and optional recurrence. and when a user buys a subscription, we simply transfer her Yiddish code to the stripe. It is also possible to set a trial period. Laravel cashier seems to cover the first point completely. I'm not sure about the second point, I haven't reached it yet.

# haven't looked at how best to do it in the current situation. there is clearly more to be discussed here. the main inconvenience is that there are quantitative restrictions on functions. and so, everything is like in a normal role model, as I see it. only instead of role - subscription

I have figured out that to upload google drive file to our API we should send object_id and a token from our front-end.

I have figured out that to upload files directly I should use the /assets/storeImageBase64 endpoint and send base64 encoded files there. It would work for all types of files, not only images. This was misleading.

From conversation with Dmitry:

We also need name - the name of the file and file_id - it looks like the file ID on Google Drive.
But the problem is that there is still a check for the file type.
Here's what you can download:

'bmp' => array('image/bmp', 'image/x-bmp', 'image/x-bitmap', 'image/x-xbitmap', 'image/x-win-bitmap', 'image/ x-windows-bmp', 'image/ms-bmp', 'image/x-ms-bmp', 'application/bmp', 'application/x-bmp', 'application/x-win-bitmap'),
      'gif' => array('image/gif'),
      'jpeg' => array('image/jpeg', 'image/pjpeg'),
      'jpg' => array('image/jpeg', 'image/pjpeg'),
      'jpe' => array('image/jpeg', 'image/pjpeg'),
      'png' => array('image/png', 'image/x-png'),
      'tiff' => array('image/tiff'),
      'svg' => array('image/svg+xml'),
      'tif' => array('image/tiff'),
      'pdf' => array('application/pdf'),
      'mp3' => array('audio/mp3', 'audio/mpeg')

Currently, the functionality is working except for some of the search results and Dropbox (they are uploaded through the same endpoint).
It may be caused by a file extension check in the API.
I have negotiated with Dmitry and asked him to check it for me as long as I could not get it working on the old staging to see how It should be done (I don't know the exact data format I should be sending).

Today I was trying to add drag-n-drop functionality for canvas elements.
After some research I tried to use react-dnd package, which looks good and highly customizable, but came across a big problem - it does not work with scaled elements. Actually it adds drag functionality to elements, but when we drag it, scale parameters are neglected and element is being displayed in full size regardless of its previous scale values.
After that, I took the react-draggable component, applied it and it works well with scaled elements.
Bad news are - I lost plenty of time messing with react-dnd. And also I need to revise current components structure to fit with react-draggable.

- Added canvas edit/view mode switching
- added draggable/resizable ability to canvas elements

here is the script which checks changes in the /var/www/html directory, deploy-changes.sh:

{no format}
#!/bin/bash
export PATH=/home/ec2-user/.nvm/versions/node/v8.11.2/bin:/usr/local/bin:/bin:/usr/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/sbin: /sbin:/opt/aws/bin:/home/ec2-user/.local/bin:/home/ec2-user/bin

DIR_TO_CHECK='/var/www/html'
PATH_TO_EXCLUDE="./node_modules*"
 
OLD_SUM_FILE='/tmp/old_sum.txt'
OLD_SUM_PACKAGES_FILE='/tmp/old_sum_packages.txt'

 
if [ -e $OLD_SUM_FILE ]
then
    OLD_SUM=`cat $OLD_SUM_FILE`
else
    OLD_SUM="nothing"
fi

if [ -e $OLD_SUM_PACKAGES_FILE ]
then
    OLD_SUM_PACKAGES=`cat $OLD_SUM_PACKAGES_FILE`
else
    OLD_SUM_PACKAGES="nothing"
fi

cd $DIR_TO_CHECK

NEW_SUM_PACKAGES=`md5sum package.json | awk '{print $1}'`
NEW_SUM=`find . \! -name package.json \! -path "./node_modules*" \! -path "./public*" \! -path "./vendor*" \! -path "./storage*" -print0| xargs -0 du -b --time --exclude=package.json --exclude "public*" --exclude=$PATH_TO_EXCLUDE | sort-k4,4 | sha1sum | awk '{print $1}'`

if [ "$OLD_SUM_PACKAGES" != "$NEW_SUM_PACKAGES" ]
then
    echo "`date -u` package.json has changed. Running npm install && gulp --production"
    echo $NEW_SUM_PACKAGES > $OLD_SUM_PACKAGES_FILE
    npm install
    gulp --production
else
    if [ "$OLD_SUM" != "$NEW_SUM" ]
    then
        echo "`date -u` directory has changed. Running gulp --production"
        echo $NEW_SUM > $OLD_SUM_FILE
        gulp --production
    fi
fi

next i've created small dockerfile with apache-php which supports laravel, dockerfile:
{no format}
FROM php:5.6-apache

#install all the system dependencies and enable PHP modules
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
      libmcrypt4\
      zlib1g-dev\
      libicu-dev\
      libmcrypt-dev\
      git\
      zip\
      unzip \
    && rm -r /var/lib/apt/lists/* \
    && docker-php-ext-configure pdo_mysql --with-pdo-mysql=mysqlnd \
    && docker-php-ext-install zip \
      intl \
      iconv\
      mbstring\
      mcrypt\
      pcntl\
      pdo_mysql\
      zip\
      opcache\
    && curl -sS https://getcomposer.org/installer | php -- --install-dir=/usr/bin/ --filename=composer \
    && a2enmod rewrite

ENV APP_HOME /var/www/html

#change the web_root to laravel /var/www/html/public folder
RUN sed -i -e "s/html/html\/public/g" /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/000-default.conf

# enable apache module rewrite
RUN a2enmod rewrite

Also welcome:

-classnames

-scss

Also, after writing the application, you will need to cover as much code as possible with unit tests (ideally 100% ).

The use of all modern features of JS (ES6+) and React is welcome.

Regarding the problem described in the ticket: December 23 - operators said that the situation with outgoing drops has improved (for megacom and beeline). Problems remained only with outgoing to the window - which are still being dropped. To test this, me and [~alexeagro] checked the sims in all channels and dragged sims from different slots to find the problem.

*finally revealed:*

- none of the sim cards of any cellular operator works in slot 30 (in which the sim card was originally 0701976705)
- and SIM card 0701976705 responds to USSD requests, but dialing to it cannot be done in any of the slots

* this means: * that problems with outgoing calls to the window are due to the fact that in fact only 2 channels work, because 30 slots with a SIM card do not work, but only redirect the call to other channels, which lengthens the dialing time and drops calls when busy more than two channels

*what did:*

- turn off slots 30 (in which the beeline is now) and 24 (in which the window is not working)
- swap sims
- enable slot 24 (with Beeline SIM card)
- disable non-working slot 30 with non-working sim card

*actually we got:*

Megacom: 3 working slots (14, 15, 16) with 3 working SIM cards
Beeline: 3 working slots (22, 23, 24) with 3 working sims
Oshka: 2 working slots (31, 32) with 2 working sims

Since Oshka is a more popular operator, we decided that it is better to turn off one of the 3 beeline channels (since the beeline is used less in our country) and connect another channel to Oshka so that there are 3 of them

Ksenia wrote to the Oshki techpod and asked them to "make 0701976705 completely identical in all settings and other number 0701976706", and they just wrote to her that they reconnected the sim card 0701976705.

*We, for our part:*

- disabled slot 24 with Beeline SIM card
- Ksenia rearranged the SIM card (beeline) from 24 slots to 30 (where the 0701976705 is)
- we checked channel 24 with a sim card - it worked

*Eventually:*

30th (non-working) slot with beeline - disabled
all other outgoing slots work properly

Megacom: 3 working slots (14, 15, 16) with 3 working SIM cards
Beeline: 2 working slots (22, 23) with 2 working sims
Oshka: 3 working slots (24, 31, 32) with 3 working sims

This problem manifests itself when all outgoing channels are busy and the operator tries to make an outgoing call

Fixed this by identifying malfunctioning channels in GOIP. Swapped SIM cards and checked call queues

One of the scenarios how to catch the problem:

- I'm sitting under the operator's trainee account: *operator-1*
- I tried to work on versions of chrome 57 (carrier) and 78 (on my poppy) - problems appear periodically, what's there, sometimes everything is fine, sometimes it's an ass. I write what I caught myself:

1. make an outgoing call from the operator's dialer (to the client / driver number, for example: megacom 0755940995)

2. at the operator at the time of dialing: one beep, then the timer starts counting on the dialer in the operator's room, and there is silence in the headphones (silence in different ways)
the average period of silence on the numbers of mobile operators:
- on the beeline from 7 to 15 seconds (always in different ways)
- per eye from 15 to 20 seconds (always in different ways)
- per mega from 5 to 10 seconds (always in different ways)

3. after some time (10-30 seconds) dialing to the number 0755940995 begins, (the call comes from the Nambo number 0550976025) * BUT * sometimes when dialing starts, the call is dropped. (caught when trying to handle a fake call)

4. The client / driver answers the call (according to the client's operators, in some cases the operator cannot hear him, but he hears the client)

*One more problem*:

When the operator calls the client/driver, and the operator is silent, the client/driver nevertheless hears everything that the operators say among themselves, and the operator thinks that he has not yet reached the client. We realized this when we listened to the recording of the call.

I don't know if this will help to understand what the problem is

Because of this, complaints from customers and drivers begin to pour in.

I didn’t go into details much, but just looking at the cron, it’s clear that the main load goes to getting reports from the database in billing

8 Reports need to be retrieved from the database, it will be necessary to go through each SQL query and deal with it in order to understand which database loads the most

Roughly speaking, we can say that each SQL (parsing, solving problems, optimizing) can be spent from one hour, given that only SQL can be optimized; in the worst case, you will either need to add indexes or change the structure of tables and databases.

8 hours minimum for banal optimization, if you need to do something more coordinatively, then it can drag on for 16 hours or more.
A rough estimate, since I can’t say what and how bad it is with a superficial analysis
The task will spend a lot of time while we stop the report manually

mr accepted

I looked at what data on orders from the history are available to mobile applications and there are no coordinates in the data set

Since all orders do not have coordinates, it can be assumed that the mobile application takes the address (text) from the historical order and the coordinates from the pin, which is not correct because they do not correspond to each other.

h2. Solution 1

The obvious solution is that when creating an order, the mobile application should not send any coordinates if the address (text) was not received from a pin or sadgest.

h2. Solution 2

When receiving orders from the history, add the coordinates of the starting point, provided that this order was automatically placed, that is, the coordinates in it correspond to the address, but this will not work correctly, since even auto-placed orders may have discrepancies with the coordinates, since such an order was created according to the scheme described in the task

h2. Solution 3

Check the address and coordinates on the backend, that is, try to find the address on the map and if the coordinates are similar (the difference is several meters), then you can automatically place an order

The problems with this solution are that the backend has no idea which order was from the pin and which from the history where you need to check the address and coordinates, that is, you will have to check all orders, which can affect the performance of the backend

{color:#ff0000}*How can I host Namba Taxi iOS project?*{color}
 # download Xcode from the Apple store (takes 1 hour)
 # download the project
 a) open the terminal, specify which folder (cd Documents) and clone the project (git clone https://gitlab.com/TaxiNamba/taxi-booking-app-ios-new.git)
 c) You can clone from the terminal from the turnip, or from Xcode itself, in both cases you will need an access token, which you need to create in your profile in the git and save this token, since it is shown only once.
 All work in the terminal with the project must be done after going to the root folder with the project
 # through Xcode open the project: which was downloaded
 # select the develop branch and go to it ( git checkout develop)
 # in the terminal we write the command (sudo gem install cocoapods) after cocoapods are installed
 # write in the terminal (pod install)
 # select stage(target) and run the project
 all these steps sometimes need to wait a very long time
 # click on your project go to the Signing & Capabilities tab in Team add your Apple account, then click on manage certificate and add the certificate and build your project
 # when prompted for keychain passworda, enter the password from your poppy, then it builds calmly

h2. *Problem*
The problem of the accuracy of mathematical operations in programming languages ​​is present everywhere
 !screenshot-1.png|!

But in this case, the maximum discrepancy will not be more than one som.

h2. *Solution*

In order to solve this problem, you will have to rewrite and test all kinds of operations with money and other numbers in most of the project

That is:
taxi-dashboard (management)
taxi-billing (Billing)


h2. *Preliminary estimate*
A rough estimate of time and perhaps this problem may take even longer, since no one has canceled the pitfalls

You will need to research how to work with money in Python and Go *(3-4 hours)*

Rewrite work with money in the dashboard *(3-5 hours)* + 2-3 hours of testing

Rewrite work with money in billing *(2-3 hours)* + 2-3 hours of testing

More specifically, the problem arose with orders that had already been copied to the archive, but had not yet been deleted from the two-week table

The error was banal in the name of the variable, which is why the order in the archive and the cost with the commission and taxes was not updated

The VPN for nambataxi services is located on the infra.swift.kg server.

To create a new configuration file with certificates for a user, do the following:

1. Connect via SSH:

```
ssh user@infra.swift.kg
```

2. Switch to root user:

```
sudo -i
```
3. Change to the /etc/openvpn:` directory

```
cd /etc/openvpn/
```
4. To create a new configuration file for a user, do the following:

```
bash gen_cert.vpn user_name
```
5. Copy the configuration file to your server download directory like this:
```
cp /etc/openvpn/clients_vpns/user_name.ovpn /home/user_name/
```
6. You can download the configuration file from the server using the rsync utility:
```
rsync -zavP user@infra.swift.kg:/etc/openvpn/clients_vpns/user_name.ovpn
```
7. Don't forget to delete the copied configuration file from your home directory.
```
rm /home/user_name/user_name.ovpn
```

Revocation of client certificates.

1. Connect via SSH:

```
ssh user@infra.swift.kg
```

2. Switch to root user:

```
sudo -i
```
3. Change to the /etc/openvpn:` directory

```
cd /etc/openvpn/
```
4. Certificate revocation:
```
bash revoke_cert.sh user_name
```

Made a script to add:

{code:java}
#!/bin/bash

mkdir -p /opt/docker/prometheus-node/textfile_collector

cat <<EOF> /opt/connection_check.sh
#!/bin/bash
i=0

while [ \$i -lt 5 ]; do
  ss-ln | grep8080 | awk '{print "ss_ln_check_connection " \$3}' > /opt/docker/prometheus-node/textfile_collector/connection_check.prom
  sleep 10
  i=\$(( i + 1 ))
done
EOF

chmod 0755 /opt/connection_check.sh

cat <<EOF> /etc/cron.d/connection_check
* * * * * root /opt/connection_check.sh
EOF

{code}

I thought about this problem for quite a long time, because it really was not clear "how is it that the balance is not updated"

Moreover, this problem manifested itself constantly sometimes more often sometimes less often sometimes we did not know about it at all because the operators hushed it up.

h2. *Context:*

each Django ORM model has a method that allows you to save model changes to the database `.save()`, this method simply takes the entire model with all its fields, just takes it and saves it to the database, and it doesn’t matter whether one field has been updated or all anyway *ALL* fields will be saved except if the `update_fields` parameter was not explicitly specified by specifying which you can control which fields will be saved in the database and which will not.

h2. *Problem*

During any change to the DriverProfile model, in most cases, when saving, `.save()` is called without the `update_fields` parameter, which ultimately causes the problem of not updating the driver balance.

Deployed

Based on the results of studying the API + communication with the payBox developers, this is how we will implement it:
1. The user clicks on the link card button and the PayBox interface for linking cards opens
2. After saving the map, we get pg_recurring_profile which allows you to pay from the backend. We receive from postLink which will come to the back or make a request to the bank from the appendix, and then transfer it to the back (not specified in the docks, but not a problem)
3. We tell the user that everything is OK and the card is linked!
4. After the card is linked, we can make payments through pg_recurring_profile only at the moment the order is completed, since only then do we know the amount for the order.

The question that remains open:
What to do if there is no money on the passenger card?

Solution:
First of all, pay from the client's account and in case of unsuccessful payment, pay from the Taxi account towards the driver. Further:
1. privately deal with the client to pay the debt towards the Taxi company.
2. Write off the amount for the train from the user's account, notifying him before creating the order about this behavior and after that about writing off the money with leaving the client's negative balance. Also prohibit calling a taxi from an account that has a negative balance.

The problem remains, what will happen when the client rolls up the amount, for example, 10,000 and it is debited from the client's balance and he does not want to pay for it?

The question is open, we ask the customer

Implementation score:
1. Creating an endpoint for saving the map with the user + creating a field for the map + deploy migration (4 hours)
2. Adding a new payment type + introducing it into the order payment process + tests (16h)
3. Creating an http client to communicate with payBox + the ability to retry requests in case of network failure + tests (12 hours)
4. Implementation of behavior in the absence of money on the card + a bunch of functionality together (9h-18h)
5. Creation of a tool to display such transactions. Assist with incident investigation and account reconciliation (10h)
6. Run-in and testing on staging along with the application. Prerelease manual testing (4 hours)

In the maximum case 64 hours without taking into account unforeseen circumstances

*Assessing Paybox Initialization in Android App*

0) studying integration (reading API documentation) 3 hours

1) Paybox SDK integration 3h + conflict resolution 2h

2) Fitting the design to our application 5 hours

3) testing 2h

4) Time to fix unaccounted factors and other subtleties of integration

I close the task because, according to the results of testing by the focus group, the feature was recognized as ineffective

h2. *What was the problem*

The report "Statement from the balance of the company" displays incorrect balances of corporate companies, since the balance of corporate companies was not calculated correctly when adjusting the corporate order in favor of the driver.

Due to incorrect adjustment, in fact, only the "Statement from the company's balance sheet" report suffered, since in it the company's corporate balance is taken from the balance field, while in all other places the company's corporate balance was displayed correctly, as it was recalculated by the debit and credit fields

h2. * What did Edakin and Astashov do in the end *

After they found a problem with incorrectly working adjustments to the corp order, they switched to the fact that the annual financial reports in 1C and the "Act of Reconciliation" and figured out why they did not converge.

h2. *Which problem did you end up finding*

h3. *Context:*

+ Previously, corp trips worked on the principle: +
I indicated the Corp code in the order and paid with a paper check

+But new logic for corps has been added:+
Specified the corp code in the order and the cost of the order was deducted from the account of the corp company of this employee

h3. *The essence of the problem*
Kodga corp company was transferred from paying for trips by checks to paying for trips at the expense of the balance of corp companies, they forgot considering that the corp company rolled the first part of the month according to the old logic and the rest according to the new one, and as a result, the company was billed twice for the first part of the month
The problem was solved within the framework of task NT-10644. We will solve the problem with reports within the framework of NT-10848. I am closing this issue.

1. If the operator confirms the order, the order is not actively processed in the client application. After confirming the order, the order remains in processing as it is. If you minimize the application and open it, then the current status of the order is displayed.

2. If the client cancels the order before the driver has arrived, i.e. on the "Car on the way" status, this case is not processed correctly in the driver's application. The order in the driver application remains active.

Found some bugs with `entrypoint.sh`

*First* at the beginning of this file is `#!/bin/sh` which determines that this file should be executed using the shell, but in `entrypoint.sh` a bash script is actually written and there are syntax errors when running through the shell
Krch should be changed to `#!/bin/bash` and I think it's worth removing the .sh extension, since this is still not a shell script

*Second* is not executed in the correct order
Context:
In the Dockerfile, the ENTRYPOINT keyword is executed before the CMD keyword, and as a result, as I understand it from the dock, they are combined into one command, which is then executed in the Dockerfile

Problem:
Since `entrypoint.sh` is executed the very first, for example, in `docker-compose.yml` the keyword `command` with the script waiting for the database to be loaded will simply be executed after this is not allowed, since `entrypoint.sh` has operations tied to the database

def find_all_duplicates(path, photo_names):
    duplicates = []
    last_photo = None
    for name in photo_names:
        photo_path = f'{path}/{name}'
        try:
            photo = Image.open(photo_path)
        # Данный эксепшен райзится если фотография не соотвецтвует формату jpeg    
        except UnidentifiedImageError:
            duplicates.append(photo_path)
            continue

        if last_photo is None:
            last_photo = photo
            continue

        difference = ImageChops.difference(last_photo, photo)

        if not difference.getbbox():
            duplicates.append(photo_path)
        else:
            last_photo = photo

    return duplicates


def delete_files(files_paths):
    for path in files_paths:
        os.remove(path)


# Проходится по всем фотографиям в указанных дерикториях 
# и удаляет дублирующиеся фото и не валидные
def remove_duplicate_photos():
    for path in paths:
        photo_names = os.listdir(path)
        photo_names.sort(key=lambda n: int(n.split('_')[-1].replace('.jpeg', '')))

        duplicates = find_all_duplicates(path, photo_names)
        print(f'Found: {len(duplicates)} duplicates of total {len(photo_names)} in {path}')

        delete_files(duplicates)
        print(f'Deleted: {len(duplicates)} duplicates of total {len(photo_names)} in {path} \n')


# после выполнения remove_duplicate_photos номера 
# фотографий идут с пробелами 0 4 5 6 и тп
# скрипт переименовывает все фотографии и получается 0 1 2 3 4 5 и тп
def simplify_names():
    for path in paths:
        photo_names = os.listdir(path)
        photo_names.sort(key=lambda n: int(n.split('_')[-1].replace('.jpeg', '')))

        for i, name in enumerate(photo_names):
            raw = name.split('_')
            raw[-1] = f'{i}.jpeg'
            new_name = '_'.join(raw)
            os.rename(f'{path}/{name}', f'{path}/{new_name}')

# Получение списка фотографий и их количество которое необходимо вставить в аргумента переодической задачи
def get_prefixes_settings():

Rewrote the logic for determining which cameras to send notifications to

https://gitlab.com/microphotographer/api/commit/f473f837d259d7024ec0710b9a80f599d96481ea

I noticed a logical error when sending notifications to cameras

The error is related to the time of the last camera photo
 !screenshot-1.png!

Now there are such settings and it is assumed that they will always work with such settings
 send_camera_notifications every *10 minutes*
 get_cameras_statuses every *5 seconds*
 NOTIFY_MINIMAL_CAMERA_LAST_PHOTO_MINUTES *10 minutes*

*+You also need to take into account the fact that the cameras have settings for the operating time of each camera+*

h2. How does it manifest

It can send false notifications that there has not been a photo from the camera for a long time, although in fact the camera is working normally and sends photos in a timely manner, or the camera should not work at all at some intervals, although again notifications will come from it

h2. First problem

Notifications for cameras are sent based on the statuses of cameras that are updated on the backend with the periodic task execution *cameras.tasks.get_cameras_statuses*, in turn, notifications have their own periodic task *notifications.tasks.send_camera_notifications*

+That is, if the camera statuses are updated every *20 minutes* and the frequency of the *send_camera_notifications* task execution and the NOTIFY_MINIMAL_CAMERA_LAST_PHOTO_MINUTES setting are less than *20 minutes*, then all cameras will receive a notification that it has not sent photos for a long time+

h2. Second problem

Each camera can have settings for the camera operation time and also for the camera update frequency for certain periods of time

That is, if the camera is set to work only during the day, then at night notifications will be sent that the camera has not sent photos for a long time, although in fact it should not send any photos at night

I fully charged the small battery, soldered myself into the gap of the toggle switch, connected the multimeter.
In the first moments of switching on, connecting to the network, the consumption from the battery is 0.3A, after the connection is established 0.6A-0.65A. A power bank at 40000mah (3.7v) at 5v will only give 25000mah (indicated on the case). With the current consumption of the power bank, it will last for ~ 38 hours of continuous operation. A small battery (1000mah) is enough for ~ 2 hours of work.

There was a problem with what to display to the user in the check operation in the terminal
h2. Context

The user in the terminal selects "Citycam.kg subscription payment", enters the payment code that the system provided him, the terminal displays a page that displays information about the user and the tariff, and the question arose of what exactly to display in the information about the user.
h2. *Discussed with Dima*

Display the mail under which the user registered
 *+* All users have a unique mail, that is, if the user is shown his mail, then this * 100% * means that he will purchase a subscription for himself and not for someone else by mistake

Display the username that the user has entered in his account
 *–* Name and Surname for all users are not unique and, accordingly, the user will not be *100%* sure that he will purchase a subscription for himself
h2. *Conclusions*

Now we decided to display the user's mail in the terminal as it looks more practical, but if there is a need to fix something, it will be quick and not difficult

The logic of the endpoints changed as a result, since the standard OSMP 1.1 protocol was not used in the end.

From OSMP 1.1, only the framework remained in the form of a check and pay operation, and XML became JSON

At easyeda in the PCB project, Microphotograper generated a pcb file and for test (without confirmation) sent it to production at jlcpcb to make sure the layers were correct. Screenshot from jlcpcb in the comments. The file is recognized.

Went to easyeda.com, created a new project. Imported a .pro (kicad) circuit diagram, created a trace file.
Arranged the elements in accordance with the approximate current arrangement of elements on the breadboard of the device.
I set the thickness of the tracks to 50mil (1.27mm) based on the current consumed by the modem and the device being in aggressive conditions.
I started autorouting, but it did not give an acceptable result (there are unrouted connections on a two-layer board)
Traced manually. The result for two layers is in the attachment.

Schematic diagram in kicad format, installed kikad, tried to trace autorouting - unrouted pins remain on the bilateral board.
Looking for alternatives, chose eagle cad, traced a simple test board, fiddled with layers for a long time to get a gerberfile, the file is displayed incorrectly on jlcpcb.com. I decided to use the native tracer from jlpcb - easyeda.com

Authorization through Google cannot be done simply through allauth. The user will have to redirect to apihi and the api will have to record the session. You should not do this, because in this case, for some users we will have authorization by tokens without sessions, and for others without tokens, but with sessions. You will need to dig into the dock: [https://developers.google.com/identity/protocols/OAuth2WebServer] and integrate it into our token authorization process. Unfortunately there is no obvious documentation in the rest-auth doc

I extend the assessment, because you will need to rummage around with the Google dock for their OAuth and integrate it into the API + do Facebook authorization, but rest-auth has a dock for it

Then I searched / studied different packages for authorization by social networks. networks, trying to apply a solution that authorized only by tokens, avoiding sessions. I even started to implement an authorization service that absolutely does not save state and does not use sessions, having previously tried to find similar solutions on the Internet - I did not find it. As a result, I quit this case, because I came to the conclusion that the solution is absolutely pointless and I did not find a similar solution in Google for this very reason.

As a result, I just used rest-auth + allauth + social-auth, which give both tokens and save sessions. Later I will document the authorization decision

Tried to write code authorizing the user behind the scenes. I stuck in a queue of problems that were not quite clearly documented in the main documentation and guides when creating the project:

1) Silent authorization cannot be used with dev keys: [https://auth0.com/docs/connections/social/devkeys#limitations-of-developer-keys]. I created an application in the Google account of the project and set the active keys of the Google account in the Auth0 dashboard

2) User permission will always be requested on localhost [https://auth0.com/docs/api-auth/user-consent#skipping-consent-for-first-party-applications]. You will need to configure local DNSs (this is fast), fix the project settings and test silent authorization again
Free map [https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-mad-map] that we use on the site
Authorization via authorization code flow with PKCE works. At the moment we will store the token in localStorage

Basic moments:

1) The URL is parsed to access_code and code_verifier on the main page, where the redirect actually takes place. Since the logic for processing the return to the user's site is quite rich, it is worth considering the option of dedicating a separate page to this logic

2) Pay attention to the names of classes and the separation of methods according to the classes, the removal of parts of the logic in their methods (general refactoring)

3) Fix helper class methods generating code verifier

You can try to resort to authorization code flow with PKCE. There are several implementations and guides for using such a flow. The most descriptive: [https://auth0.com/blog/oauth2-implicit-grant-and-spa/#The-Implicit-Grant] In general, you will need to do:

1) Send the user to auth0 with the parameter response_type=code so that the user is returned with an authorization code, not a token

2) Generate a code challenge and a code verifier to prevent getting an access token by stealing the access code

3) Send a request to auth0 to receive an access token, in exchange for an access code and a code verifier

Thought about and studied the risks and inconveniences between storing the token in localStorage and in session: strong immunity against CSRF, but increased potential vulnerability against XSS.

But the project has a very small attack surface via XSS, since we don't get a lot of input from users, like, say, a blog. At the same time, in case of refusal to store keys in the session, the principles of the REST architecture, on which it was decided to build a back, are not violated, and all the advantages of using the architecture

So from now on, the plan is finalized to develop authentication through OAuth2.0 and the client to store the token in localStorage

It turned out that there are two scenarios for working with local payment systems: either they access our API, or we access their API.

If we refer to them:

In general, at the data level, you will need a submodule for working with partners, and there each class will be specific to the partner's API and a submodule for working with internal data (transactions, amounts, ID bindings from partners, etc.)

If they contact us:

We define api endpoints for various operations in the process of communicating with them, and then we begin to implement the functionality for our payment API

Came to 3 backend modules:

1) Authorization (imitation of authorization server). I think the most applicable authorization protocol will be OAuth2 (at least its most primitive implementations). I think we won’t do an authorization server yet, but it’s quite possible to abstract it from other resources.

2) Checking the access of the camera to the client and getting the signed url from s3

3) A payment module that works with third-party payment services. It will need to be worked out separately in more detail, in task MIC-46

s3 restricts access to buckets by special keys. By generating a signed url, we officially give permission to the recipient of the url to use the image for a period specified by us, i.e. Signed urls CORS is unlikely to limit.

But if the photos in the bucket do not have any public access, and the PWA backend is the only issuer of the signed receipt links, then it will be possible to regulate access to various resources on it, depending on the type of account.

Searched the docs and google for possible pre signed url issues with other users, the only significant one is that direct access to s3 costs money ($0.0004/10,000 requests, $0.09/1GB) but will provide uninterrupted supply of objects for an almost unlimited number of connections (previously cited dock from Amazon).

Creating a pre signed url with a limited time of use and issuing them by user role is the best option for the project.

I read a little: the doc above contained recommendations for the design of an application that works with s3. There was nothing in the documentation about structuring buckets.

Having studied the essence of buckets a little more, it is unlikely that there will be any guidelines on best practices. A bucket is a "key:object" type of storage. Because Since we don't plan to store huge amounts of objects in buckets for long periods of time, it's probably enough for us to rely on filtering by prefixes (names of "folders") in queries through boto3

But to dock above nevertheless studied. The doka refers to two subsections. Summary below

[https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/optimizing-performance-guidelines.html]

Amazon assures that buckets have no limits on the number of connections to them, i.e. even at later stages, it will be possible to create many parallel connections and send as many get requests as needed. Useful to consider when planning and implementing a backend

Timeouts and reconnects: implemented by the used SDK. We will later need to tweak them depending on the needs of the project.



[https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/optimizing-performance-design-patterns.html]

It is unlikely that our backend will need any of the things listed in the dock



Caching: not necessary, because we have nothing to cache. We provide clients with links to the freshest images every 3 seconds.



About timeouts and reconnections was higher. And because we delegate receiving objects to clients, it's not really about our application.



Not at this stage, but in the future it may be necessary:

SDK Metrics [https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/sdk-metrics.html]

Amazon S3 Transfer Acceleration maybe yes, maybe not, but definitely at the stage of scaling to several countries

The most optimal scenario would be: generating a pre-signed url on the server and returning them to the client, so that the client requests resources (photos) in s3 directly - it will remove the load from the server and without an intermediary in the face of the server, loading resources (images) from clients should be faster .

At the point a job is marked as complete (by either a customer or a provider) the provider should receive a notification reminding them to pay us our fee (Notification 4 and 27). This can be set up as an Internal, SMS and Email notification and we can pause whichever we want. We will likely use a lot of email and internal to save money on SMS expenditure).7 days after the job has been marked as complete, another notification should be sent to state that payment is overdue and, if the fee is not paid in 7 days, then their account will be paused and no new job leads received. The wording for these notifications is as follows:*Email*: “It has been 7 days since we were told that this job was complete. Please follow the link below to make a payment for our fee for this job. If we don’t receive a payment in the next 7 days, your account will be placed on pause, meaning you won’t receive any new job leads until you make the payment. If you have any issues with this job or making payments, please contact us on [info@sortedhouse.com|mailto:info@sortedhouse.com]. Thank you for using Sorted House.”*SMS*: “Please pay our fee for this job to avoid your account being paused in 7 days”*Internal*: “Please pay our fee for this job to avoid your account being paused in 7 days”13 days after the job has been marked as complete, a second reminder reiterates the message sent after 7 days. The wording for these notifications is as follows:
**
*Email*: “As of tomorrow, your debt to sorted house will have been outstanding for 14 days. Please make payment within the next 24 hours or your account will be paused and you will no longer receive further job offers. If you have any issues with this job or making payments, please contact us on [info@sortedhouse.com|mailto:info@sortedhouse.com]."*SMS*: "Please pay our fee for this job now to prevent your account being paused in 24 hours”*Internal*: “Please pay our fee for this job now to prevent your account being paused in 24 hours”14 days after the job has been marked as complete, the provider's account is put on pause and they can only un-pause the account by making payment for the outstanding fee. The wording for these notifications is as follows:*Email*: “Your account is now paused due to lack of payment. You will not receive further job leads until this debt has been cleared. Please follow the link below to make a payment for our fee for this job. If you have any issues with this job or making payments, please contact us on [info@sortedhouse.com|mailto:info@sortedhouse.com]."*SMS*: "Your account has now been paused. Please pay our fee for this job to receive job leads again."*Internal*: "Your account has now been paused. Please pay our fee for this job to receive job leads again.”

Samat, I need some clarification.
1. Is the rating of Provider recalculated every time he got job completed?

2. Is the rating of Provider is recalculated every time when a Customer puts review for a job?
3. Do we need to keep the history of his rating? Or just updates the fields in Rating model?

4. There is discrepancies between [https://pm.maddevs.co/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=41353497] and [https://pm.maddevs.co/confluence/display/SOR/3.+ System+settings#id-3.Systemsettings-_csx2ulby9w37.]
In original TR (total rating) could be > 1. But in the updated version it is said that the TR should be within -1 and 1 range.


5. this Element 1 in the updated version. the math doesn't make sense:
```
_CFR = ((LCFR x TA) + (% of TA))/TA_

 _50 + 1 / 100 = 0.51_
 _500 + 10 = 0.51_

 If positive then _% = 1_
 If negative then _% = -1_
 If neutral then _% = 0.5_

```
Why 500 + 10 = 0.51?
In the original the formula was Review Score = ((LCFR x LTA) + (Y x LTA)) / LTA ?
6. For formula 2
``` _CR = (LCR x TA) + (% of TA)/ TA_

If a supplier selects a job is complete _% = 0.5_
If supplier select a job did not happen _% = -0.5_
```
It seems that we depend on the Customer Review. And if there is no review provided by Customer? Should we take the previous review if available? Or should there be some default value?

7. In addition, if there is no review from Customers, but the total accepted job will be increased and his rating will be decreasing. Do we need to envision some default for last job result if there is no Customer review?
8. Question about the cut-off rate? If it is applied we don't give the tender to this provider, in this case, the provider will never get a chance to get out of this situation.

I had 1 provider for the customer and asked for 1 more. That said there are no more providers for that job.

I cancel job quote from provider side:

!Selection_006.png|thumbnail!

but at the same time on the customer side:

!Selection_007.png|thumbnail!

no other options on what to do. I guess clients expect that customer should reply if this provider completes this job anyway?

*026*

I was able to look at the job in more detail, despite the status reading “Expired”. The images I had uploaded as a customer when submitting the job are not attached. This is one of many examples where images don't appear to be working (I didn't receive any errors or “Failed” message when uploading them to the job).There is no rough location being shown (and no error message from Google Maps in its place).The message tells the provider the job has expired (even though 60 seconds have elapsed only and they are the only provider who covers that job). I chose Yes.



*027*

The customer received notification stating "Provider sent a job quote" – can you change this to: "A provider would like to speak to you".On this screen the message reads: "Would you like to share your information with provider for the following discussion" – can you change this to "Would you like to share your details with the provider below?"
 If a customer wants to share their details, the message reads: "Share my contacts" – can you change this to: "Share my details"The location also isn’t being displayed on this screen for the customer either.



*031*
 I marked the job as complete as a provider and was shown the following message: "You completed this job. Don't you forget to pay for this lead to us?". Can you change this to: "You have marked this job as complete. Our fee for this job will be shown in Payments."
 Even though the provider marked the job as complete, a notification popped up on the provider’s account stating that the customer had marked the job as complete (the customer did receive the correct notification, stating that the provider had completed the job).



*032*

These options were available to the customer when the job was still in progress. Again, they are only accessible via the small three gray dots. This section is unclear to a customer – they need to be given the options “This job is complete” and “Cancel this job” and also need a “are you sure” before confirming either of the selections.



*036*

Status of the job is displayed to the provider is “Expired”. However, if you click on the job, the provider can still choose to accept it (as in this test, no other provider has accepted the job). If a provider sees “Expired” when first glancing at their job list, they would likely think that the job is dead and they wouldn’t click on it. Is it possible to have the status as something like “Timeslot Expired” if the job has not been accepted by any other providers but has passed the providers time slot? [@Saul G|https://sortedhouse-maddevs.slack.com/team/UM3UT9GCF], what are your thoughts on this?

*037*

On the customer side, the status says “Providers Found”. But, if you click through, the notification at the bottom of the screen states “We are contacting providers for your job” but I am unable to view anyone.
Should the message for a customer in this circumstance read: “We are waiting for the providers to accept your job”? Otherwise, this could cause confusion as we are saying we have found providers but aren't showing them to the customer.
Again, any input from [@Saul G|https://sortedhouse-maddevs.slack.com/team/UM3UT9GCF] too would be great.
